Du kan læse mere om, hvordan det er at arbejde hos os på: www.clever.dk/velkommen eller vores Instagramkonto @liveticlever. Er du nysgerrig på vores rekrutteringsproces kan du læse mere om den her: Rekrutteringsprocessen i Clever | Clever . Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer, Computer Vision
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to develop computer vision and machine learning solutions for closing the gap between plan and reality for large scale construction projects, with the goal of minimizing waste through digitalization?

Your new role

Bringing data from offices to the construction site using 3D BIM models has long been part of our core expertise here at Dalux. Now, as one of the next steps in our effort to digitalize the construction industry, we are working to bring data from the construction site back into the office using modern Computer Vision techniques.

As a Machine Learning Engineer in our Computer Vision section, you will be a key part in delivery of the solutions into production. You will participate in the full lifecycle of the ML systems we build, while spearheading the model deployment, performance monitoring and maintenance, to ensure the reproducibility of our experiments and traceability of our pipelines in production. As part of the R&D team, you will be expected to keep up to date with the state-of-the-art in the ML/CV area as well as new techniques and processes.

Your background

We believe you…


Have 3+ years of experience as a Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps Engineer, or similar.
Have a proven track record of bringing machine learning models to production.
Have a solid theoretical foundation from a degree in computer science, engineering, IT or similar.
Can work both independently and as part of a team.


Most important is your problem-solving attitude, passion for software craftmanship, and the ambition to participate in the full lifecycle of our machine learning solutions.

Our tech...


Python
PyTorch
C++
OpenCV
AWS
MLFlow
Kubernetes


We are focused on using the right tools for the job, and as such the list of technologies may change depending on our needs and new offerings.

What To Expect As a Daluxian

In our organization the way from idea to product is short, combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.

You will become a part of a highly skilled team of passionate individuals driven by the wish to explore new and reshape existing technologies. As Dalux is a software company, we want half of the company to consist of Software Developers. All our software development happens at our head office at Vibenshuset in Copenhagen.

We offer...


Central location in Copenhagen, focus on work/life balance without any overtime, and no dress code.
An active social environment with monthly events and social clubs.
Flat communication in our organization, where the way from idea to product is short combined with creative freedom and a high level of trust in your work, ensures that you will be able to create tangible value for our users.
You’ll join a highly specialized, international team with room for creativity and professional growth.
Strong focus on diversity and inclusion – your ideas are heard, and opportunities are available to all.
Attractive employee benefits such as health insurance, lunch plan, coffee and fruit, free fitness facilities, and parking garage.
Focus on your development and well-being, with support for both professional goals and personal growth.


Ready for the next step

If Dalux sounds like a place where you could develop and contribute to the high-quality software, we would gladly accept your application. We will be having ongoing interviews.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact Simone Jena Berg Christensen.

Who Is Dalux

Dalux is a Danish software company founded in 2005 by Ph.D. Bent Dalgaard and Torben Dalgaard. Dalux’ products are aimed at making the construction industry smarter and more effective as it is the world’s 2nd largest industry and amongst the least digitalized. Our user-friendly digital tools and Building Information Modelling-technology (also known as BIM) is used in more than 160 countries globally.

We are crazy about cool technology and have experience being first movers on new tech. Our products are based on our unique 3D BIM-technology and makes use of AR - all developed entirely by Dalux.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Machine Learning Platform Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence and excited to work at the intersection of Cloud Infrastructure and cutting-edge ML/AI solutions in a fast paced business? This is your chance to embed with our Fundamental Modelling (FM) team, developing large-scale ML/AI models using and supplying terabytes of meteorological data to drive insights and competitive advantage in energy trading.




About the Role

We’re seeking a hands-on ML Platform Engineer to work directly with the Head of Fundamental Modelling as a strategic business partner, while reporting to the Manager of Cloud Development ensuring an anchor in the wider technical organization.

Your mission: Enable our FM and Quant Trading teams to focus entirely on sophisticated modelling and meteorology solutions by ensuring platform infrastructure and operations run seamlessly in the background.

You’ll help maintain and expand our hybrid infrastructure using Azure Cloud and on-premise high-performance computing (HPC) resources, ensuring the right balance of performance, agility, reliability and cost for each use case.




Key Responsibilities

Develop and manage the ML platform for large-scale data and complex ML models.
Implement MLOps best practices to streamline development and deployment.
Optimize the platform’s performance and efficiency across Azure Cloud and on-premise HPC.
Ensure smooth transition of ML and Big Data applications from development to production.
Proactively solve infrastructure issues and improve platform reliability.
Partner with data scientists and engineers to enable successful deployment and monitoring.
Drive platform improvements to meet business and technical needs.




We expect that you are familiar with several of the topics below and are ready to embrace learning the rest in your job with us!

Experience building and maintaining ML platforms in data-intensive environments.
Strong experience with Azure Cloud, Docker, and Kubernetes.
Expertise in GPU-based ML training and high-memory computing.
Experience with HPC infrastructure and cloud integration.
Ability to assess and recommend the best infrastructure solutions.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills.
Experience with time-series or geospatial data is a plus.




Personal Competencies

Collaborative: You work well with data scientists and engineers to solve challenges together.
Business-driven: You seek to understand business needs and deliver effective solutions.
Proactive: You anticipate problems and address them before they escalate.
Customer-focused: You ensure the FM team can rely on the platform without friction.
Adaptable: You adjust strategies based on changing business and technical requirements.
Clear communicator: You explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Did we pique your interest?

Click the "APPLY" button - we are continuously looking for talented people to join our team.

Title: Senior Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:



Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices



Please apply if you have:



Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models



Benefits:



Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
Focus on mental health and well-being:

Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
No meeting Fridays

Paid parental leave
Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
Paid volunteer time
Focus on your career growth:

Development Dollars
Leadership development
Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings

Travel Discounts
Employee Resource Groups
6 weeks paid vacation
Pension plan contributions
Private health & life insurance
Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
Professional espresso machine
Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).


Show more
HTML:
KAYAK, part of Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG), is the world’s leading travel search engine. With billions of queries across our platforms, we help people find their perfect flight, stay, rental car and vacation package. We’re also transforming business travel with a new corporate travel solution, KAYAK for Business.

As an employee of KAYAK, you will be part of a travel company that operates a portfolio of global metasearch brands including momondo, Cheapflights and HotelsCombined, among others. From start-up to industry leader, innovation is in our DNA and every employee has an opportunity to make their mark. Our focus is on building the best travel search engine to make it easier for everyone to experience the world.

The Marketing Measurement team's mission is to improve KAYAK's ability to measure the efficiency of marketing efforts. This role works closely with marketing leaders to make better data-informed strategic marketing decisions.

As a Senior Data Scientist on this team, you will have the opportunity to develop the frameworks and roadmaps to tackle marketing measurement challenges in an efficient way, work with the stakeholders to align on priorities, and closely work your team to build the robust measurement and experimentation solutions!

In this role, you will:


  • Manage into end to end experimentation from formulating hypotheses, experiment design to collecting right data, doing power analysis to finally then implementing and analyzing experiment results
  • Support in the initiatives towards building a robust framework for efficiently creating and evaluating creative, bidding and landing page experiments
  • Develop new models and advanced analytics techniques to measure and optimize the marketing spend in a robust manner
  • Support the development of less senior scientists, collaborates with team members to assure timely delivery of high-quality work
  • Build standardized and scalable solutions, and lead from front in setting up the best practices


Please apply if you have:


  • Advanced degree (Masters, PhD) in Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
  • Extensive experience with data manipulation and extraction using relational databases (SQL)
  • Ability to write high quality, scalable, maintainable code (Python, R)
  • Strong story-telling and presentation skills to understand and communicate in the language of business partners, mostly within Marketing
  • Strong foundation in experimentation methods and causal inference techniques
  • Experienced in marketing science measurement methodologies like Causal impact, geo-lift on Google, and Marketing mix models
  • Proactive work style, needing minimal guidance and demonstrating good judgment
  • Has a keen sense of success criteria and demonstrates success through end-to-end QA. Independently adheres to strong testing and validation principles
  • Passionate about large data sets in marketing, finance, and economics. Skilled in paid marketing data, time-series analysis, econometrics, and regression models


Benefits:


  • Work from (almost) anywhere for up to 20 days per year
  • Focus on mental health and well-being:
    • Company-paid therapy sessions through SpringHealth
    • Company-paid subscription to HeadSpace
    • Company-wide week off a year - the whole team fully recharges (and returns without a pile-up of work!)
    • No meeting Fridays
  • Paid parental leave
  • Generous paid vacation + time off for your birthday
  • Paid volunteer time
  • Focus on your career growth:
    • Development Dollars
    • Leadership development
    • Access to thousand of on-demand e-learnings
  • Travel Discounts
  • Employee Resource Groups
  • 6 weeks paid vacation
  • Pension plan contributions
  • Private health & life insurance
  • Lunch provided five days per week & breakfast once a week
  • Professional espresso machine
  • Awesome office in the city centre of Copenhagen
  • Monthly social events, yoga, Thursday bars

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

At OpenTable/KAYAK, we aspire to be a workplace that fosters inclusion and reflects the diverse communities we serve. Hiring people with different backgrounds and perspectives is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users, partners, and teams. We strive to be an open and welcoming environment so that no matter who you are, you can be yourself.

We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation(s).

Title: Data Scientist til Danica
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Er du passioneret for at skabe værdi gennem data? Kan du omsætte komplekse data til klar indsigt? Er du dygtig til at facilitere krav og forstå behovene fra forskellige interessenter? Hvis ja, så har vi den perfekte stilling til dig som Data Scientist i vores Business Data & Analytics team hos Danica.

Vi søger kompetencer indenfor SQL, Alteryx, Python og Tableau

Vi søger dig der har solide kompetencer inden for SQL, Alteryx, Python, og Tableau. Du har erfaring med dataanalyse og data visualisering, og du trives med at samarbejde på tværs af forskellige faggrupper og stakeholdere.

Dine primære ansvarsområder vil være at:


Levere værdifuld indsigt til både forretning og ledelse.
Identificere nye datakilder og muligheder for at optimere vores dataanalyse og -visualisering.
Samarbejde med kollegaer i teamet og på tværs af organisationen for at sikre, at vores data er pålidelige, relevante og anvendelige.
Drive datavisualiseringsprojekter på tværs af organisationen.


Vi leder efter en person med følgende kvalifikationer:


Interesse for kodning og en stærk baggrund i dataanalyseværktøjer såsom SQL og Alteryx
Erfaring med datavisualiseringsværktøjer, som f.eks.Tableau, til at udarbejde visuelle rapporter og interaktive dashboards
En proaktiv tilgang til at identificere nye muligheder og udfordringer i vores data
Evnen til at kommunikere komplekse analyseresultater til ikke-tekniske kollegaer og stakeholdere
En positiv og samarbejdsorienteret tilgang til arbejdet


Vi tilbyder udfordringer, udvikling og fremtid

Hos Danica tilbyder vi en spændende og udfordrende stilling i et innovativt og dynamisk arbejdsmiljø, hvor du vil have mulighed for at udvikle dine kompetencer inden for dataanalyse og -visualisering.

Du vil blive en del af teamet Business Data & Analytics, som er en del af CFO-området. Teamets rolle er at understøtte forretning og ledelse med dataanalyser og –indsigter. I Danicas nye strategi, Forward 28, spiller data en central rolle, hvor teamet bidrager med levering af analyser og data til at sikre god kundeoplevelse og vækst gennem fortsat forbedring af processer og datadrevne beslutninger. Vores team har ansvaret for hele processen fra indsamling, transformering og analysering af data, til design af visuelle dashboards og formidle resultater og indsigter til vores stakeholders. Vi er kendetegnet ved en uformel, ligefrem, åben og ærlig omgangstone. Derudover har vi et højt fagligt niveau og fokus på vidensdeling. Vi samarbejder for at sikre gode løsninger for vores stakeholders og for at lære af hinanden. Vi holder til i Danica, som er i Danske Banks hovedsæde i Postbyen i København lige ved Hovedbanegården.

Spørgsmål

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, så kan du kontakte Janne Jensen, Head of Business Data & Analytics på mailadresse jannej@danicapension.dk eller telefon 61 71 82 83.

Vi afholder løbende samtaler, så send gerne dit motiverede CV hurtigst muligt.
Show more

Title: AI Engineer Student Intern
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Description

﻿(Please be situated in the Copenhagen area, and send your application by email to db@rebloom.ai)




Are you a student with proficiency in Python programming and passionate about the newest applications of AI? And are you enrolled on a relevant line of studies such as Software Development / Data Science / Machine Learning / Computational Physics? Then this might be an ideal opportunity for you.




Join ReBloom as a Student Intern

Only formal requirement is experience in Python programming and a strong interest in experimenting with cutting edge AI tools and/or machine learning developments.
Internship scope and commitment will be discussed between the student, the student’s academic institution, and the ReBloom CTO.




We are looking for a student proficient in Python programming to undertake an internship of an agreed upon duration where we will scope a project spanning experimental applications of AI agents and/or machine learning applications in finance. The development will mostly take place in Python.




About Us

ReBloom is a tech startup based in Copenhagen at Vesterbro. We are rapidly accelerating development of our live platform, and are creating industry first applications of agentic AI systems for use in private markets in finance. We have really strong traction already with top tier assets on the platform.




Why Join Us?

Work with cutting-edge AI frameworks and push the boundaries of agentic AI.
Collaborate in a dynamic, innovative startup environment that encourages experimentation.
Gain real-world experience in applied AI or Machine Learning.




It is a plus if the student has knowledge of

General programming knowledge including APIs and data structures.
Knowledge of AI frameworks or Machine Learning models.




Please send a letter expressing your interest to db@rebloom.ai




We look forwards to reading your application.

Title: Scientist in Applied Research
Place: Hørsholm, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

Join us as our new Scientist

Do you want to find biological solutions that help create a better and more sustainable world? And do you want to help establish new business areas that can pave the way for a brighter future?

Our Animal In Vitro Research department at Novonesis is looking for a committed and skilled scientist with a passion for assay development, automation and programming of liquid handlers and digitalization. Naturally, you will also need a strong personal drive, curiosity and collaboration in a changing environment.

Welcome to Animal Biosolutions Applied Research

As part of Animal Biosolutions Applied Research, Animal In Vitro Research focuses on product development and innovation that is based on scientific understanding of the mode of action, application and industry knowledge – all in close collaboration with core R&D, Marketing and other stakeholders.

We believe that the best results are created in an informal atmosphere and an environment of honesty and mutual trust with plenty of room for humor, as well as personal and professional development.

Located across sites in Lyngby and Hørsholm, our team is represented by a diverse range of cultures, expert knowledge and professional expertise.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By

This role allows you to work on new product development and life-cycle management projects in close collaboration with research teams and marketing. You will develop new assays, prepare SOPs, automate the assays on liquid handler, and test for enzyme and probiotic activity in feed and other environmental samples, among other tasks. You are a strong team player who engages proactively, keeps an open mindset with a can-do-attitude and communicates clearly with stakeholders. You stay curious, continuously seek to improve and learn, and embrace changes as they come.

To Succeed You Must Hold


M.Sc. or Ph.D. in Biotechnology, Biochemistry, or related scientific discipline
Solid enzyme/probiotic-substrate understanding and experience with assay development
Ability to drive implementation of new assays on liquid handling workstations and ambition to develop further in this area
Proficiency in data analysis, statistics, programming (e.g. Python, Jupyter notebooks, JMP), and effectively documenting results
Desire to learn new things and take ownership for processes, coordination with team, interact with stakeholders to ensure good fit between customer needs, requirements and daily workflow
Strong communication skills, an open-minded positive attitude, and a desire to achieve results together with others


Location: Kogle Alle 6, Hørsholm.

Application deadline: May 29th, 2025. We will screen in-coming applications and invite for interviews continuously during the application period, so please apply as soon as possible.

Contact details: Senior Department Manager Signe Eskildsen Larsen at SELR@novonesis.com.

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!

The Mission Awaits

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.

Your Role As An Engineering Manager


Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.


Ideal Qualifications


Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.


Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
Join BESTSELLER TECH and Shape the Future of Fashion with Scalable AI!

Do you want to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI research and real-world impact?

We’re looking for an MLOps Engineer to help us deploy and maintain robust, scalable machine learning systems that drive critical planning decisions across our global fashion business.

YOUR TEAM

You will be part of BESTSELLER TECH’s AI Fashion Planning team – a cross-functional product team of data scientists, product owners, and engineers working together to develop innovative solutions for demand forecasting, allocation, and replenishment. Our AI models support planners across BESTSELLER’s global fashion business, ensuring the right products reach the right stores at the right time.

YOUR ROLE

As an MLOps Engineer, your mission is to take our machine learning models from prototype to production, ensuring they’re reliable, scalable, and deliver real business value. You will work closely with data scientists to build reusable pipelines, automate model lifecycle management, and set up monitoring to track model health over time.

Your key responsibilities will include:


Designing and implementing CI/CD workflows, (especially GitHub Actions) and deployment strategies for ML models.
Maintaining and improving our MLOps infrastructure built on Databricks and Azure.
Ensuring robust monitoring, versioning, and logging of data, features, and models.
Ensuring reproducibility, scalability, and performance of our ML services.
Setting up automated testing and model validation pipelines to ensure production quality.
Driving best practices in MLOps across the AI department through shared tooling and documentation.


Your Benefits


Join one of the world’s leading fast fashion companies and help build the future of AI-powered fashion planning.
Work in a modern MLOps setup using Databricks, Unity Catalog, MLflow, and infrastructure-as-code tools.
Collaborate with passionate, skilled colleagues across data science, engineering, and product disciplines.
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and the opportunity to influence the future direction of AI at BESTSELLER


YOUR PROFILE

You are an experienced MLOps Engineer or a software/data engineer with strong DevOps skills and a passion for building production-ready ML systems. You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy translating experimental code into scalable services.

We expect you to bring:


Solid hands-on experience with Databricks, Azure, MLflow, and modern data engineering tools.
Proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, PyTorch, XGBoost).
Strong understanding of CI/CD for ML, version control, containerization (Docker), and orchestration tools.
Familiarity with the concepts of the medallion architecture, feature stores, and model monitoring.
A proactive mindset with a drive to improve systems and processes.
2-4 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Fluent in English, both verbal and written.


CURIOUS FOR MORE?

Get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH by following #bestsellertech on LinkedIn.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to reach out to Jakob Blaavand on +45 21 68 49 41. Otherwise, please send your application and CV as soon as possible, and no later than May 29 2025.We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad when we find the right candidate.

Work location: Aarhus, Denmark

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.

THE ROLE

Zeta Global is seeking a talented and versatile Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed Exchange team within our highly skilled development office in Copenhagen. This team plays a critical role in developing and deploying Zeta’s next-generation data science and engineering technology, collaborating closely with our global teams in New York, Berlin, and Prague. The Copenhagen office boasts a dynamic and focused environment, comprising a core group of start-up veterans and approximately 30 highly skilled professionals.

As a member of the Exchange team, you will contribute to the analysis, development and maintenance of our complex AI-powered ad-exchange platform, a sophisticated ecosystem of interconnected systems. This newly established team will tackle a continuous stream of challenging projects originating from across the organization, demanding a high degree of expertise and innovation. We are seeking candidates with a strong foundation in data science, machine learning engineering, and data analysis, and a demonstrated interest in exploring the intersections between these disciplines. As we are building production machine learning systems, experience or interest in software development principles, data engineering, and MLOps practices are highly desirable.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate for the Machine Learning Engineer position at Zeta Global Copenhagen is a highly motivated and analytical individual with a passion for understanding complex systems. You are adept at using data to identify issues, formulate solutions, and develop robust algorithms and software. You thrive in an environment that offers significant autonomy in planning and executing your work, yet you are also a strong collaborator, readily engaging with fellow developers and international product stakeholders.

You will be involved in every stage of the development process, from initial brainstorming to ongoing maintenance, with a primary emphasis on analysis, prototyping, and development. Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.


A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.


Desired Qualifications


Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.


You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases

While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases

Title: Graduate Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
I am working with an exciting research consultancy looking for a Graduate Developer!




They are a forward-thinking company focused on revolutionizing the way biological data is analysed and shared, offering cutting-edge solutions to the research community. As they expand, they are looking for talented professionals to help build innovative software platforms that will drive scientific progress.










The Role




As the company continues to grow, they're looking to bring on a Graduate Developer to join their close-knit team of 10.




This is an ideal opportunity for someone who is due to graduate this summer and has a solid foundation in React and Next.js, whether through university projects, internships, or personal work. You'll work closely with backend developers to build and integrate new features and contribute to exciting client-driven projects from day one.




If you're passionate about development and eager to learn in a fast-paced, supportive environment, this is an amazing opportunity to start your career.




You will be working mostly on site in their Copenhagen office.




Benefits

Salary between 40K – 55K DKK per month
25 Days holiday
Paid lunch at the company office







If this role could be for you drop me an email at gabby.bergonzi@amicusjobs.co.uk

Title: Data & AI Engineer
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about developing large enterprise solutions with the latest technology? Do you want to implement large cloud-based solutions in Microsoft Azure?

📍 Location: Ballerup, Aarhus

As a data engineer, you will develop and implement Azure-based solutions that improve data integration, data quality, and data flow to support business processes and strategies. You will be a key part of our projects from start to finish and contribute to decisions regarding technology selection that meets customer needs.

Your role

Responsibilities

In this role, you will help customers achieve their data and analytics strategy by setting up robust data warehouse and reporting solutions for processes such as finance, logistics, sales, manufacturing, projects and more. You will collaborate with developers, customers and business consultants to implement solutions on Azure. You will have the opportunity to use cutting-edge technology such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services and the Power BI Premium platform. A senior data engineer has extensive experience and in-depth knowledge of data warehouses, ETL tools, SQL, APIs and data modeling. You understand complex requirements and thrive when transforming these into robust data flows and structured views with high data quality and where future changes can be easily implemented. In this role, you will manage how decisions within each area affect the overall solution. Responsibilities will include:


Develop robust data warehouses with an end-user focus for a variety of processes
Building the infrastructure required for data extraction, transformation, and loading from a variety of sources
Write good, clean and efficient code
Use new technology like Microsoft Fabric, Azure Synapse, Databricks, Analysis Services, Power BI Premium and more
Create fast and accurate data models


Why is this a great job opportunity?

We focus on the latest trends in the market and Microsoft technology to ensure that we match the customer's needs to develop their own business with our technological insight. This means that you will work with the latest solutions for a future in the cloud. We want a lifelong customer relationship and work together with exciting companies, both locally and internationally. We are committed to following standards so that the solutions we deliver have a long life and are easy to develop as the customer's needs change.

Qualifications

Just like us, you are passionate about making the world more data-driven based on the latest technologies and methods.

To be successful in the role, we see that you have:


A degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Experience within Microsoft's Data Platform, on-premises or cloud (AWS or Azure)
Experience with ETL processes, data warehousing and data modeling
Very good skills and experience with SQL
Speaks fluent Danish and English
Experience with developing SSIS, SSAS and Power BI and preferably Microsoft ERP
Proficiency in programming languages as Python, Java or Scala
Danish residency


Why become part of Columbus?

At Columbus, we care about each other as much as we care about our business. Therefore, we offer:


Not just a job, but a career: You will have access to a varied training program, including online and physical courses, to accelerate your career development and support your personal and professional growth
Belonging: At Columbus, we value teamwork and have a good collaborative environment. You will be part of a company where your colleagues have deep industry insight and a strong understanding of our customers' needs
Work-life Balance: The well-being of our employees is a priority. We want you to be the best version of yourself at work, so we offer high flexibility to shape your own workday
Global Impact: You will be part of a local and global team that is at the forefront of industry trends, with opportunities to influence and improve our service offerings on an international level


Become a part of Columbus!

You can easily apply by connecting your LinkedIn or by uploading a CV via the link. Interviews will be held on an ongoing basis.

We are looking forward to receiving your application!

About Columbus

At Columbus, you’ll be joining a global IT consulting company with over 1,600 dedicated professionals. We are at the forefront of digital transformation, present in 7 countries helping 1,100 customers securing their future by driving growth through data-driven insights and creating seamless digital experiences.

With our broad industry experience in both B2B and complex B2C, we stand out as the leading digital sales partner in the Nordic region. You’ll be part of a team that designs and implements top-tier, industry-specific solutions, unleashing the full potential of our customers' digital businesses.

We believe in Digital transformation for a better tomorrow, where we also commit to drive positive social and environmental change on a global scale!

www.columbusglobal.com

Work at Columbus

Curious about life at Columbus? Check out our Instagram or LinkedIn feed to see our team in action, get insights into our culture, and discover what makes Columbus a great place to work!

Title: IT Platform Engineer for MLOps (Machine Learning) Area
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

In Data Science Platform Squad, we Build and maintain a generic, scalable and govern platform for Data Science model of online models to enable an automated, compliant and efficient Model Life Cycle process. We use technologies like Open-Shift to build Containerized platform for Hosting Model execution & Deployment.

Our squad is responsible for hosting Python statistical and machine learning models, primarily serving the Data Science communities who develop these models on behalf of various enterprise domains within the bank. We manage AAPF (Advanced Analytical Platform for Fraud), which works alongside CMDEP (Containerized Management Deployment and Execution platform) to execute machine learning models for scoring payment transactions for fraud, including e-banking domestic/international and District International models deployed in CMDEP. Additionally, we are tasked with transforming the current On-Prem infrastructure into a Cloud-Native platform.

As a MLOps IT Platform Engineer, you will work closely with the Product Owner and Chapter Lead in a “2 in a box” model, using agile methodologies. You will be responsible to develop and maintain scalable ML pipelines on futured MLOps platform built on AWS and Databricks. You will be tasked with ensuring seamless and automated transition of models from development to production using CICD workflows, implement the infrastructure as code. You will ensure that our machine learning models operate reliably, efficiently and at scale.

You will:


Implement automated pipelines for model training, validation and inference
Build and maintain CI/CD workflows using Github actions to ensure model code is versioned and seamlessly deployed to production
Utilize tools like MLflow for model tracking, versioning and deployment
Use terraform to provision and manage scalable secure infrastructure required for ML workloads
Leverage docker containers to build, deploy and manage containerized ML models


About you:


Minimum of 2 years of practical experience in MLOps platform to build model development deployment, execution and maintenance of ML pipelines
In-depth knowledge of AWS services and Databricks
Proficiency in Python, Pyspark
Experience in CI/CD tools Terraform and container orchestration
Problem-solving and debugging skills
Understanding and practical experience with PubSub and Kafka streaming services would be beneficial
Upper-Intermediate English skills


“We believe that the most valuable asset is human potential.”

We offer:

If you are hired in Lithuania, the applicable salary range will be from 3280 EUR to 4920 EUR gross (based on your competencies relevant for the job).

Additionally, each Danske Bank employee receives employee benefits package which includes:


Growth opportunities: professional & supportive team, e-learnings, numerous development programs; (incl. professional certificates); 100+ professions for internal mobility opportunities.
Health & Well-being: a diverse, inclusive, work & life balance work environment; additional health insurance; mental well-being practices; partial psychologist counselling compensation; silence and sleep zones at the office; game rooms.
Hybrid working conditions: Work from home up to two days a week; home office budget (after the probation period); modern Danske Campus workplace developed with anthropologist for the best employee experience.
Additional days of leave: for rest, health, volunteering, exams in higher education institutions, and other important activities. Moreover, for seniority with Danske Bank.
Monetary compensation package: accidents & critical diseases insurance; financial support in case of unfortunate events, travel insurance; IIIrd Pillar Pension Fund contribution.


See all the benefits HERE .

Your title in job contract will be IT Platform Engineer.

If you're interested in this role and joining my team, feel free to contact me - Dinesh Chaudhari via LinkedIn or email dinc@danskebank.dk , and I will answer your questions!

#DK

About Us

Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

Title: Senior AI Engineer
Place: Hillerød, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
As the Senior AI Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and deploying artificial intelligence and machine learning models. You will work closely with data scientists, software developers, and business analysts to design intelligent solutions that enhance our products, services, and operations. Simplicity and adaptability is important in everything we do!

Principal Accountabilities


Model Development: Design, develop, and implement machine learning and AI models to solve business problems.
Data Preparation: Collaborate with data engineers to ensure data is prepared and curated for model training, including data cleaning and feature engineering.
Integration: Work with software engineers to integrate AI models into existing or new applications using APIs or other integration methods.
Testing & Evaluation: Conduct rigorous testing and evaluation of models to ensure accuracy, efficiency, and scalability, and refine models based on performance metrics.
Deployment: Deploy AI models into production environments, monitor their performance, and iterate based on user feedback and business needs.
Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify AI opportunities and provide technical expertise.
Research: Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI technologies and methodologies and apply them where applicable.
Documentation: Document model designs, development processes, and integration workflows for future reference.
All other duties assigned.



Minimum Education And Experience Required


Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field.
5+ years of experience in AI and maching learning and deep learning model development/frameworks: TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras, Scikit-learn, XGBoost
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, Java, C++, and/or MATLAB



Knowledge, Skill And Abilities


Proven experience utilizing cloud platforms: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, IBM Watson
Advanced knowledge of all AI aspects (Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Maching Learning, Deep Learning, Generative AI, Large Language Models)
Working knowledge of stakeholder management within IT and business
Strong communication skills
Ability to convey technical information in a concise manner to a variety of audiences
Excellent problem solving skills and ability to work in a team environment
Knowledge of basic algorithms, object oriented and functional design principles, and best practice patterns



Application deadline: May 16th

As part of any recruitment process, FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies collects and processes personal data relating to job applicants. The organisation is committed to being transparent about how it collects and uses that data and to meeting its data protection obligations and may share this as part of the global recruitment process with hiring managers in Europe and the United States.

FUJIFILM Diosynth Biotechnologies is an industry leading Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with locations in Teesside, United Kingdom; RTP, North Carolina; Holly Springs, North Carolina; Thousand Oaks, California; Hillerød, Denmark; and College Station, Texas. We use our skills, dedication, and ambition to enable impact for the world’s most innovative biotech and biopharma companies reimagining healthcare’s potential. We work across the entire lifecycle of our customer’s products – enabling success throughout. Every cure, vaccine, biologics, and advancement we contribute to starts with our people and our passion.

To all agencies: Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of FUJIFILM about this requisition. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at FUJIFILM via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method will be deemed the sole property of FUJIFILM, unless such search firms/employment agencies were engaged by FUJIFILM for this requisition and a valid agreement with FUJIFILM is in place. In the event a candidate who was submitted outside of the FUJIFILM agency engagement process is hired, no fee or payment of any kind will be paid.

Title: Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
Imagine working with cutting-edge machine learning models, designing robust and scalable software infrastructure, and collaborating with dedicated colleagues — all while playing a key role in scaling our business even further.




Does this sound exciting? Then you might be our new Machine Learning Infrastructure Engineer at Alipes Capital.




At Alipes Capital, we have been a market leader in automating financial markets since our inception in 2008, pioneering fully automated natural language processing systems to read and interpret financial news.




To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.




In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.




Key responsibilities include:

Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations




You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.




About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.




About you

Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets and training distributed models
Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
A few years of experience in production-grade environments working with the full Machine Learning stack from dataset generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask)
Familiarity with containerization technologies (for example Docker Compose or Kubernetes)




Nice to have

A scientific and inquisitive mind
Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.




If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

Show more
