At Alipes Capital, we have been a market leader in automating financial markets since our inception in 2008, pioneering fully automated natural language processing systems to read and interpret financial news.


To accomplish our goal of being the best at what we do, we are focused on building a world-class ML engineering workflow, ensuring seamless training, deployment and monitoring of our predictive models. Your work will be instrumental in further developing the infrastructure that transforms massive unstructured financial data sets into production-ready inference models that drive real-time trading decisions.


In doing so, you will get a chance to help develop scalable, high-performance ML systems, ensuring a seamless pipeline from dataset generation through model prototyping to production deployment.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Designing and optimizing infrastructure to support distributed model training and experiment tracking
  • Building and automating robust data pipelines for dataset generation and feature engineering, while enabling data version control
  • Developing software for rapid experimentation and deployment, including automated testing, continuous integration, and delivery
  • Implementing best practices in software development, ensuring maintainability, scalability, and efficiency of ML systems through automated testing and real-time monitoring,
  • Improving model deployment workflows, focusing on minimizing latency, ensuring reproducibility, and enabling fast iterations


You will get instant validation of your work and experience short feedback cycles, where going from inception to deployment can be a matter of hours. There will be no red tape to cut and no sales people to consult.


About the team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued, and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with passionate quantitative researchers covering 8 nationalities – fourteen PhD’s and three MSc’s with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning. We enjoy collaboration and are always willing to lend a helping hand. We are working alongside two other teams of software developers and traders that implement and conceive the mathematical models together with us. What makes this constellation work great is that all of the individual team members write code and are willing to engage on a deep, technical level of understanding.


About you

  • Fluency with computer science fundamentals – data structures and algorithms
  • Experience working with ‘out-of-core’ datasets and training distributed models
  • Experience with Python, in particular the data preprocessing, ETL pipelines and distributed systems
  • Familiarity with strongly typed languages like C# or C/C++ or Rust
  • A few years of experience in production-grade environments working with the full Machine Learning stack from dataset generation through model training and real-life validation and monitoring
  • Experience with distributed computing frameworks (for example Spark, Ray or Dask)
  • Familiarity with containerization technologies (for example Docker Compose or Kubernetes)


Nice to have

  • A scientific and inquisitive mind
  • Experience working with tools like PyTorch, Tensorflow, XGBoost and/or Catboost
  • Familiarity with algorithmic trading concepts
  • PhD or MSc degree in engineering, computer science, mathematics or physics


What we can offer you

  • Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
  • Exciting problems to solve
  • Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
  • Nice office in Nordhavn with a hybrid work model
  • Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation


Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. If your profile looks like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.


If you have specific questions about the role, you are welcome to email us at quant_jobs@alipescapital.com. Please do not send in your applications to this email address, as our interview team will not have visibility to review.

Title: Recently graduated Engineer, wanting to work within AIT Quality at Novo Nordisk Engineering
Description:
Does the idea of working in Quality IT excite you? And do you thrive on gaining knowledge of GXP and pharmaceutical production? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for graduates to join our team of engineers in Automation IT Project Quality Management. As a team, we are working on the biggest projects in Novo Nordisk.

Why do we need you? Our goal is to implement robust and excellent solutions for our owner. Your role will be key in learning about development, doing testing and verification of master batch records and supporting our Quality Engineers.

Location Kalundborg Department Automation IT Project Quality Management

Experience Graduate level Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Graduate, you’ll be:


Getting on-the-job training and guidance to be confident and prepared to support some of our clients’ most complex manufacturing execution issues
Contributing in gathering technical requirements through a variety of techniques (e.g., facilitated workshops, work sessions and interviews, technical analysis)
Learning from senior colleagues with an innovative mindset to ensure that workflows / recipes are successfully and compliantly designed, developed, deployed in line with site business processes and technical standards
Commissioning and undertaking test and qualification of IT systems in manufacturing environments
Estimating and coordinating own tasks
Depending on your profile it would be Quality or IT system Validation. We will have a talk about where we see your potential.



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:


A team-oriented person, curious and eager to learn
Comfortable with customer relations
Proficient in spoken and written Danish and English
Passionate about your work and with a personal drive
Pro-active, cooperative and with a motivated mindset.



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions, there are some things that are preferred, and others, a bonus. If you do not meet all the qualifications listed below, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.


An engineering, computer scientist or similar degree or a having pharmaceutical production experience.
Experience with IT on various levels



Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions
Inclusive environment that values diversity and equity



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Deadline of application is 10 June, 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Manager Ima Mir on +45 30 75 55 86.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com
Show more

Title: Software Engineer - New Grad (2025 Start)
Description:
RDQ225R601

At Databricks, we are passionate about helping data teams solve the world's toughest problems — from making the next mode of transportation a reality to accelerating the development of medical breakthroughs. We do this by building and running the world's best data and AI infrastructure platform so our customers can use deep data insights to improve their business. Founded by engineers and dedicated to our customers, we leap at every opportunity to solve technical challenges, from designing next-gen UI/UX for working with data to scaling our services and infrastructure across millions of virtual machines. And we're only getting started.

As a software engineer, you will work with our engineering team to build infrastructure and products for the Databricks platform. We're hiring across all of our teams, including backend, full stack, infrastructure, databases, systems, tools, cloud, and customer-facing products. You will join a cohort of engineers who will build their careers through collaborative projects and learning opportunities. With a dedicated mentor and supportive team, you'll onboard quickly and start contributing to impactful projects soon after starting here at Databricks!

The Impact You Will Have


Work with a team to build features and improve architecture for the Databricks platform
Develop and extend the Databricks product
Own full software development lifecycle: design, development, testing, and operating in production
Build solutions with a high level of reliability, scalability, and security


What We Look For


You have graduated in December 2024 or will graduate no later than Summer 2025 with a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related subject
You have implementation skills with a general purpose program language, such as Python, Java, or C++
You have knowledge of algorithms, data structures, and OOP principles
You have experience managing end-to-end projects


We are hiring Software Engineer - New Grads across multiple offices. Please apply for the single location that you're the most interested in, and we will discuss more with you as you move through the process. We can only consider one application in 30 days.

About Databricks

Databricks is the data and AI company. More than 10,000 organizations worldwide — including Comcast, Condé Nast, Grammarly, and over 50% of the Fortune 500 — rely on the Databricks Data Intelligence Platform to unify and democratize data, analytics and AI. Databricks is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices around the globe and was founded by the original creators of Lakehouse, Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow. To learn more, follow Databricks on Twitter, LinkedIn and Facebook.

Benefits

At Databricks, we strive to provide comprehensive benefits and perks that meet the needs of all of our employees. For specific details on the benefits offered in your region, please visit https://www.mybenefitsnow.com/databricks.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

At Databricks, we are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone can excel. We take great care to ensure that our hiring practices are inclusive and meet equal employment opportunity standards. Individuals looking for employment at Databricks are considered without regard to age, color, disability, ethnicity, family or marital status, gender identity or expression, language, national origin, physical and mental ability, political affiliation, race, religion, sexual orientation, socio-economic status, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.

Compliance

If access to export-controlled technology or source code is required for performance of job duties, it is within Employer's discretion whether to apply for a U.S. government license for such positions, and Employer may decline to proceed with an applicant on this basis alone.

Title: Senior Scientist for Down Stream Process Development
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior Scientist for Down Stream Process Development

Are you driven by the challenge of turning lab-scale processes into robust, scalable production systems?
Does developing and optimizing downstream recovery of innovative food ingredients excite you?
Are you looking to make a tangible impact in an innovative startup environment?




Join Chromologics as our Senior Scientist for Downstream Process Development and help shape the future of food colorants through precision fermentation.




At Chromologics, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the food industry by producing sustainable, fermentation-based natural colorants. With solid support from international investors and a team of 17 professionals across fermentation, biotechnology, food science, and business, we are advancing from pilot operations to commercial readiness.




Your Role: Advancing Downstream Processes




As Senior Scientist for Downstream Process Development, you’ll lead the development and scale-up of pigment recovery from our precision fermentation processes. Your responsibilities span from hands-on development in our pilot facility to process transfer and technical collaboration with external manufacturing partners.




In this role, you will:

Design, optimize, and scale downstream unit operations, including solid/liquid separation, membrane filtration (ultra/nano)
Evaluate, select, and help install new processing equipment as we expand our in-house DSP line.
Conduct experimental work, troubleshoot processes, and prepare comprehensive documentation to ensure successful tech transfer and production scalability.
Continuously improve performance through data-driven insights, lab trials, and feasibility studies.




What We’re Looking For

You are a curious, self-motivated scientist ready to shape the future of food technology. You thrive in dynamic environments and enjoy solving complex technical challenges.




Your qualifications:




Have a MSc in chemical engineering, biochemical engineering or biotechnology, potentially combined with a PhD.
Have at least 2 years of industrial experience, preferably as a (bio)process engineer, working with fermentation-based manufacturing processes
Strong background in recovery processes e.g., solid/liquid separation, membrane processing, and Solid Phase Extraction.
Have a strong analytical and creative mind, combined with a lot of personal drive
Flair for data analysis e.g., mass balances, drawing conclusions, and presenting outputs to scientific and non-scientific audiences




You’re excited about working in a growing startup where flexibility, initiative, and big-picture thinking are key to success.




Welcome to Chromologics!




Chromologics was founded in 2017 and uses precision fermentation to produce novel colorants. Our technology platform will enable us to be early movers in introducing exclusively lab-grown natural food colorants to the market that are high-performing, cost-competitive, and sustainable alternatives. Unlike other existing natural colors, our colorants are not extracted from high-value labor-intensive raw materials like fruit & vegetables or insects but are produced via fermentation. Chromologics R&D is transforming our work from lab to product commercialization.




Chromologics offers you the ability to gain experience and take on broader responsibilities. We are an international and diverse team located at the Innovation House at Alfa Laval in Søborg – your office will be in Søborg. We thrive on innovation, sustainability, and applied technologies. Our facilities are within cycling and public transportation distance of Copenhagen, with access to the Alfa Laval canteen and fitness facilities. 




Salary and employment terms will match the experience and background of the right candidate.




Any questions please write to COO Karsten Dinesen kdinesen@chromologics.com and use below link to apply.




Application deadline: May 28th, 2025. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

Show more

Title: Student - Research & Development
Description:
Terma is facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. In space, we are engaged in reaching new frontiers and helping people across the globe tackle current and future challenges.

Terma offers multiple motivating student worker positions in various departments within our Research and Development (R&D) organization.

As a student in R&D, you will experience a variety of tasks and have the opportunity to practice your theoretical skills. We pride ourselves on always having an open work environment where we help each other stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value to our colleagues throughout Terma.

Team and role

As a student in R&D, you will be part of an organization with a lot of engaged international employees, where specialized technology, deep knowledge, playful innovation, and continued improvements are driving factors in everything we do.

You will be working closely with highly skilled colleagues, working on exciting internal and external products and projects, and you will be growing together with other passionate students as a part of our internal people pipeline. You might work on the future of software, making the world safer through security, defense and space applications, and through advanced analytics that secures the right decision-making around the world, or you are building the future radars for airports, harbors, and ships.

Qualifications

Your background is not important if you have a passion and interest in working professionally in a high-tech company and look forward to setting your footprint. We are open to candidates from many different programs.

We Are Currently Seeking Student Workers Pursuing a Bachelor’s Or Master’s Degree In Disciplines Such As, But Not Limited To


Software- and Systems Engineering
Data Scientist and Cybersecurity
Management- and Business Development


The Key To Success As a Student Worker Is To Show Commitment, Work With Passion In Groups And Independently, Have An Outgoing And Proactive Personality With Humor And Curiosity, And Show Initiative In Daily Work. Therefore, It Is Essential That


You can communicate in English
You take pride in making things happen, particularly when identifying and proactively dealing with issues
You can solve your tasks within set deadlines and with a strong focus on quality and detail, in close cooperation with your colleagues
You work in a structured manner and can coordinate and manage several things simultaneously without losing track


______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com.

Applications will be processed continuously.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Any unanswered questions?

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis. If you have any need for further information, please do not hesitate to contact oabh@terma.com

We are really looking forward to receiving your CV.

Bear in mind that candidates must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defence Intelligence Service. This entails that candidates, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.

The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Data Enablement Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About the job




Role Overview

As a Data Enablement Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you'll play a crucial role in building and evolving our streaming-first, self-service data platform, enabling software developers, data scientists, analysts, and product teams to efficiently address complex operational and analytical challenges. Your contributions will directly influence data-driven decision-making and product innovation across the organization.

Specifically you will support internal teams’ adoption of the platform, creating reusable patterns, documentation, and providing consultative support for complex use-cases. You should expect that the role will involve a lot of hands-on data engineering (co-engineering/peer programming) initially.




About Us

At Ønskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally.




Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. Our benefits include daily lunches, comprehensive health insurance, lively social events, and much more. This position is not remote. Relocation packages are not offerred.




Key Responsibilities

Initially, handle building the first set of stream/batch processing pipelines and reusable patterns to bootstrap self-service adoption.
Develop documentation, templates, blueprints, examples, and reference implementations for analysts and developers.
Conduct onboarding, training sessions, workshops, and ongoing enablement.
Support software developers and analysts when they face complex scenarios or edge cases.
Gradually shift from initial ownership to advisory/support as internal users gain maturity and autonomy.




Technical Experience

Stream Processing & Data Engineering:
Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Apache Beam
Experience in building and optimizing streaming/batch pipelines (transformations, aggregations, joins, enrichments).
Data Modeling & Schema Management:
Schema Registry, Avro, Protobuf, JSON Schema, schema evolution practices.
Data modelling (star-schema, OBT, semantic)
Analytical & Operational Use-Cases:
Understanding of analytical data use-cases, real-time dashboards, or operational applications.
Exposure to SQL and analytical tools (Databricks SQL, Snowflake, BigQuery, Looker, Tableau).
Exposure to DBT
Documentation & Communication:
Experience producing technical documentation, user guides, tutorials.
Strong ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely to varied audiences (analysts, engineers, managers).




Nice-to-Have

Proactive, customer-centric mindset—actively identifying user needs and gaps.
Excellent interpersonal skills to collaborate closely with internal users.
Experience delivering training sessions, workshops, or technical presentations.
Comfortable providing guidance and mentorship in complex situations.




Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of experience in Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Developer Advocacy roles.
Past experience in an enablement, consulting, or advisory position strongly preferred.
Demonstrated track record of improving adoption and maturity of self-service data platforms.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer, CloudKitchens - Aarhus Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

At CloudKitchens, we're building Infrastructure for Better Food. We help restaurateurs around the world succeed in online food delivery. Our goal is to make food more affordable, higher quality and convenient for everyone. We're changing the game for restaurateurs, whether they’re entrepreneurs opening their first restaurant all the way through to your favorite global quick-service restaurant chains.

What You’ll Do


Design and build fault-tolerant architectural systems that scale proportionally with business growth and can stand the test of time.
Operate storage and network across our multi-regional fleet of Kubernetes clusters and manage lifecycle with automation.
Write, debug, maintain, and test code in a high-velocity agile environment.
Work alongside other engineers and stakeholders to improve overall systems, availability, and SLO.


What We’re Looking For


5+ years of backend software engineering experience, ideally with experience on core infrastructure, or platform engineering teams.
Expertise in distributed systems, and experience designing large-scale distributed systems that are scalable, reliable, and with high performance.
Experience in Golang development.
Nice to have specialized in Kubernetes, Istio, Security, and Network, and public cloud providers like Azure, GCP, and AWS.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.


Why join us


Growing market: You’ll be focused on an $80 billion market that’s projected to reach at least $500 billion by 2030 in the US alone.
Changing the restaurant industry: You’ll be part of a team that helps restaurants succeed in online food delivery.
Collaborative environment: You will receive support and guidance from experienced colleagues and managers, helping you to learn, grow and achieve your goals, and you’ll work closely with other teams to ensure our customer’s success.


What Else You Need To Know

We are hiring across Infrastructure Network and Storage teams, Multiple seats are available for candidates who are eager to learn and grow their technical in-depth.

This role is based in our Aarhus office location. We believe that people do their best work when they are together. As a company, we’re in the marketplace of ideas and innovation. When you’re constantly innovating, changing how an industry works, inventing new products and processes - and we are doing all these things - we believe we’re better as a team in-person. That’s why all of our teams (except for our field-based roles) are now working from one of our office locations 5 days a week. Looking forward to sharing more about a Career of Substance at City Storage Systems.

Ready to join us as we serve those who serve others?

For more information about our privacy policy, please view this link here: css-careers.com/privacy

Title: AI Engineer, Denmark - BCG X
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our AI Software Engineers and Senior AI Software Engineers are part of our rapidly growing engineering team and help to build the next generation of AI solutions. You’ll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions. Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Software Development, Large-scale Data Analytics And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following


Apply software development practices and standards to develop robust and maintainable software
Actively involved in every part of the software development process
Experienced at guiding non-technical teams and consultants in and best practices for robust software development
Optimize and enhance computational efficiency of algorithms and software design
Motivated by a fast-paced, service-oriented environment and interacting directly with clients on new features for future product releases
Enjoy collaborating in teams to share software design and solution ideas
A natural problem-solver and intellectually curious across a breadth of industries and topics


#BCGXjob

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

#BCGXjob

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.

BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Title: AI/ML Engineering Manager
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Our vision is to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. We are well on our way—but there’s still an exciting journey ahead. Join us at the heart of trust.

Engineering Manager

Calling All Transformative Engineering Managers!

Are you a natural leader with a passion for empowering teams and driving operational excellence in AI and machine learning? Whether you come from a ML/AI engineering, data engineering or software engineering background, Trustpilot is looking for a driven Engineering Manager to lead our AI Platform team!

The Mission Awaits

As an Engineering Manager at Trustpilot, you’ll lead a team focused on building and maintaining the infrastructure, tools, and processes that enable scalable, reliable, and efficient AI and ML operations. Your leadership will be key in defining and evolving best practices for deploying, monitoring, and managing AI and ML models in production. Your technical expertise and leadership will shape the future of AI and ML operations at Trustpilot.

Your Role As An Engineering Manager


Lead, mentor, and inspire a team of engineers, fostering a collaborative and high-performance environment.
Drive the team’s technical vision, ensuring alignment with business goals and best practices in AI and ML operations.
Own the delivery process, ensuring initiatives are implemented on time and to the highest standards of quality, scalability, security, and reliability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, removing roadblocks and driving innovation in how we productionise AI and ML models.
Support career growth for your team, creating pathways for learning and development, and providing regular feedback.
Collaborate with Data Science, Platform, and Product teams to ensure AI and ML models are deployed, monitored, and maintained effectively.
Promote best practices in model deployment, observability, CI/CD for ML, and responsible AI principles, helping engineers embed these into their workflows.
Oversee the development and implementation of scalable AI and ML pipelines, ensuring efficient experimentation, versioning, and monitoring of models.
Partner with other engineering and product leaders to shape Trustpilot’s overall AI and ML strategy while fostering cross-functional collaboration.
Champion operational excellence in AI and ML, ensuring models are reliable, reproducible, and continuously improved.


Ideal Qualifications


Experience managing and leading ML/AI Ops, Data platform or software engineering teams.
Strong technical background as a ML, Data, Software Engineer or a Data Scientist.
Strong understanding of engineering principles and a willingness to learn and work with AI and ML operational challenges.
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, able to navigate complex technical and business challenges and turn them into actionable goals.
A passion for building teams and coaching engineers to grow in their careers, whether from an AI, ML, data, or software background.


Our Commitment To Diversity & Inclusion

At Trustpilot we want to create a strong feeling of belonging, for every Trustie, where you don’t feel like you have to ‘fit in’, you can just be you, your really awesome self. A place where you’re treated fairly, your perspective is valued, and you’re empowered to do the best work of your life. Trustpilot is committed to this vision. We want to be a part of creating a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive world of work for all. Join us in breaking barriers and reshaping the tech industry!


A range of flexible working options to dedicate time to what matters to you
Competitive compensation package + bonus
25 days holiday per year, with an extra 5 days holiday allocated after your 1 year anniversary (prorated)
Two (paid) volunteering days a year to spend your time giving back to the causes that matter to you and your community
Rich learning and development opportunities are supported through the Trustpilot Academy, LinkedIn Learning, and Blinkist
Comprehensive health package, pension, and full access to Headspace, a popular mindfulness app to promote positive mental health
Paid parental leave
Central office with a laid-back vibe and constant buzz of different languages being spoken everywhere you go It’s complete with a coffee bar, canteen, and table tennis and has a wide variety of refreshments available - you can opt-in for breakfast and lunch at an affordable price
Regular opportunities to connect and get to know your fellow Trusties, including company-wide celebrations and events, ERG activities, and team socials
Opportunity to join the Trustpilot Social Club for a small monthly fee and attend regular social and leisure activities like go-karting, cooking classes, and escape rooms
Employee discounts to restaurants and shops


Still not sure?

We are Open to All, which means we want everyone to feel like they can see themselves at Trustpilot. We're keen to hear about your experiences as well as how you can help to create a fantastic culture for our amazing Trusties. So, don't worry if you're looking at this job description and feel like you don't meet all the requirements, we'd still really like to hear from you!

About Us

Trustpilot began in 2007 with a simple yet powerful idea that is more relevant today than ever — to be the universal symbol of trust, bringing consumers and businesses together through reviews. Trustpilot is open, independent, and impartial — we help consumers make the right choices and businesses to build trust, grow and improve.

Today, we have more than 300 million reviews and 64 million monthly active users on average across the globe, with 140 billion annual Trustbox impressions, and the numbers keep growing. We have more than 1,000 employees and we’re headquartered in Copenhagen, with operations in Amsterdam, Denver, Edinburgh, Hamburg, London, Melbourne, Milan and New York.

We’re driven by connection. It’s at the heart of what we do. Our culture keeps things fresh –– it’s built on the relationships we create. We talk, we laugh, we collaborate and we respect each other. We work across borders and cultures to be the universal symbol of trust in an ever-changing world. With vibrant office locations worldwide and over 50 nationalities, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace with diverse perspectives and ideas.

Our purpose to help people and businesses help each other is a tall order, but we keep it real. We’re a great bunch of humans, doing awesome stuff, without fuss or pretense. A successful Trustpilot future is driven by you –– we give you the autonomy to shape a career you can be proud of. If you’re ready to grow, let’s go.

Join us at the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is committed to creating an inclusive environment where people from all backgrounds can thrive and where different viewpoints and experiences are valued and respected. Trustpilot will consider all applications for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, religious beliefs, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, neurodiversity, disability, age, parental or veteran status. Together, we are the heart of trust.

Trustpilot is a global company and our data practices are designed to ensure that your personally identifiable information is appropriately protected. Please note that your personal information will be transferred, accessed, and stored globally as necessary for the uses and disclosures stated in our Privacy Policy.

Title: Natural Language Processing (NLP) Researcher
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.




At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.




Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies




You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.




The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).




We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.




Need to have

Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
A meticulous and detail-oriented mind




Nice to have

Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
Working with financial/trading data
Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
Degree in Computer Science / Engineering




What we can offer you

Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
Exciting problems to solve
Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people
Nice office in central Copenhagen with a hybrid work model
Pension, Health Insurance and 30 days of vacation




Practicalities

To apply, please send us your CV and a cover letter telling us why you think this role is a great fit for you. In your cover letter, if applicable, please describe a project where you extracted structured or unstructured information from text - including the techniques, tools, models used and how those extractions informed further decisions/predictions.

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Show more
HTML:
Do you want to impact a highly-skilled team that uses cutting edge techniques in Natural Language Processing and Algorithmic Trading? We are looking for an NLP Researcher that will help us greatly improve the text-processing behind our models.


At Alipes Capital, we have been the market leader in automating the financial markets since we started back in 2008, shaping a fully automatic natural language processing system for reading and interpreting financial news.


Your work

Your work will support turning massive data sets of unstructured financial information into structured datasets and mathematical models that accurately predict movements in the equity markets. In doing so, you will:

  • Redesign and introduce new text-processing techniques to extract additional and more accurate entities from the text-sources that underlie our trading algorithms
  • Maintain and curate new and existing text data sources for our analyses
  • Automate monitoring and benchmarking of the trading strategies


You will enjoy a wide degree of autonomy and responsibility to optimize our machine-learning pipelines, from data-ingestion to live-model performance. There is no red tape, no sales people to consult and there is ample room for creativity.


The team

All of this will happen in an informal atmosphere where technical discussions are valued and you are encouraged to take ownership of, and pride in, your work. You will impact the direction of the team, prioritize your work and choose the tools that get the job done. We are a tight-knit modeling team with fourteen passionate quantitative researchers covering six nationalities – eleven PhD’s and three MSc’s- with expertise in statistical analysis, mathematical modeling and machine learning (seven of us working directly on the text-based equity models).


We enjoy collaboration, lending a helping hand and discussing the business cases built upon our data-sets. You will be working alongside a team of software developers and a team of traders who implement and conceive the trading models with us. All team members write code and are not afraid to discuss technical details.


Need to have

  • Skilled in extracting signals from texts using embeddings to enhance prediction model
  • Proficient in entity-extraction from text, e.g. using modern Transformer-based Large-Language Models
  • Solid understanding of machine learning techniques and their practical applications
  • Aptitude for programming in a numerical scripting language (we primarily use Python)
  • A meticulous and detail-oriented mind


Nice to have

  • Experience using RAGs (Retrieval-Augmentation-Generation)
  • Working with financial/trading data
  • Experience with C#, C/C++ or Java
  • Familiarity with software engineering (version control, unit testing, object oriented-design)
  • Degree in Computer Science / Engineering


What we can offer you

  • Flat hierarchy and high levels of trust and autonomy
  • Exciting problems to solve
  • Collaborative team made up of really smart and curious people

Practicalities

If you're selected for an interview, we will be very interested in discussing technical details with you about this project!

Should your profile look like a good match, we will get in touch to coordinate an online technical test as a first step in the interview process.

Title: MLOps Engineer
Description:
Join BESTSELLER TECH and Shape the Future of Fashion with Scalable AI!

Do you want to bridge the gap between cutting-edge AI research and real-world impact?

We’re looking for an MLOps Engineer to help us deploy and maintain robust, scalable machine learning systems that drive critical planning decisions across our global fashion business.

YOUR TEAM

You will be part of BESTSELLER TECH’s AI Fashion Planning team – a cross-functional product team of data scientists, product owners, and engineers working together to develop innovative solutions for demand forecasting, allocation, and replenishment. Our AI models support planners across BESTSELLER’s global fashion business, ensuring the right products reach the right stores at the right time.

YOUR ROLE

As an MLOps Engineer, your mission is to take our machine learning models from prototype to production, ensuring they’re reliable, scalable, and deliver real business value. You will work closely with data scientists to build reusable pipelines, automate model lifecycle management, and set up monitoring to track model health over time.

Your key responsibilities will include:


Designing and implementing CI/CD workflows, (especially GitHub Actions) and deployment strategies for ML models.
Maintaining and improving our MLOps infrastructure built on Databricks and Azure.
Ensuring robust monitoring, versioning, and logging of data, features, and models.
Ensuring reproducibility, scalability, and performance of our ML services.
Setting up automated testing and model validation pipelines to ensure production quality.
Driving best practices in MLOps across the AI department through shared tooling and documentation.


Your Benefits


Join one of the world’s leading fast fashion companies and help build the future of AI-powered fashion planning.
Work in a modern MLOps setup using Databricks, Unity Catalog, MLflow, and infrastructure-as-code tools.
Collaborate with passionate, skilled colleagues across data science, engineering, and product disciplines.
Enjoy flexibility, autonomy, and the opportunity to influence the future direction of AI at BESTSELLER


YOUR PROFILE

You are an experienced MLOps Engineer or a software/data engineer with strong DevOps skills and a passion for building production-ready ML systems. You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy translating experimental code into scalable services.

We expect you to bring:


Solid hands-on experience with Databricks, Azure, MLflow, and modern data engineering tools.
Proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks (e.g. scikit-learn, PyTorch, XGBoost).
Strong understanding of CI/CD for ML, version control, containerization (Docker), and orchestration tools.
Familiarity with the concepts of the medallion architecture, feature stores, and model monitoring.
A proactive mindset with a drive to improve systems and processes.
2-4 years of experience as a Data Engineer, Data Scientist or Machine Learning Engineer.
Excellent problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.
Fluent in English, both verbal and written.


CURIOUS FOR MORE?

Get a glimpse of what life is like in BESTSELLER TECH by following #bestsellertech on LinkedIn.

WE LOOK FORWARD TO HEARING FROM YOU

If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to reach out to Jakob Blaavand on +45 21 68 49 41. Otherwise, please send your application and CV as soon as possible, and no later than May 29 2025.We review applications on an ongoing basis and reserve the right to take down the ad when we find the right candidate.

Work location: Aarhus, Denmark

About Bestseller Tech

We are more than 300 people strong, located in Denmark and in Spain. We are excited about what we do, but there’s more to us than our tech stack. We are young at heart and thrive in a flat organization. Our teams are agile and empowered with end-to-end responsibility. We want to be at the forefront of the newest technologies, and we move forward together. Every day. If you want to play a significant part in empowering our business, then welcome to BESTSELLER TECH. BESTSELLER TECH is part of the worldwide fashion company BESTSELLER. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.
Show more

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Who We Are

Zeta Global (NYSE: ZETA) is the AI-Powered Marketing Cloud that leverages advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and trillions of consumer signals to make it easier for marketers to acquire, grow, and retain customers more efficiently. Through the Zeta Marketing Platform (ZMP), our vision is to make sophisticated marketing simple by unifying identity, intelligence, and omnichannel activation into a single platform – powered by one of the industry’s largest proprietary databases and AI. Our enterprise customers across multiple verticals are empowered to personalize experiences with consumers at an individual level across every channel, delivering better results for marketing programs. Zeta was founded in 2007 by David A. Steinberg and John Sculley and is headquartered in New York City with offices around the world. To learn more, go to www.zetaglobal.com.

THE ROLE

Zeta Global is seeking a talented and versatile Machine Learning Engineer to join our newly formed Exchange team within our highly skilled development office in Copenhagen. This team plays a critical role in developing and deploying Zeta’s next-generation data science and engineering technology, collaborating closely with our global teams in New York, Berlin, and Prague. The Copenhagen office boasts a dynamic and focused environment, comprising a core group of start-up veterans and approximately 30 highly skilled professionals.

As a member of the Exchange team, you will contribute to the analysis, development and maintenance of our complex AI-powered ad-exchange platform, a sophisticated ecosystem of interconnected systems. This newly established team will tackle a continuous stream of challenging projects originating from across the organization, demanding a high degree of expertise and innovation. We are seeking candidates with a strong foundation in data science, machine learning engineering, and data analysis, and a demonstrated interest in exploring the intersections between these disciplines. As we are building production machine learning systems, experience or interest in software development principles, data engineering, and MLOps practices are highly desirable.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate for the Machine Learning Engineer position at Zeta Global Copenhagen is a highly motivated and analytical individual with a passion for understanding complex systems. You are adept at using data to identify issues, formulate solutions, and develop robust algorithms and software. You thrive in an environment that offers significant autonomy in planning and executing your work, yet you are also a strong collaborator, readily engaging with fellow developers and international product stakeholders.

You will be involved in every stage of the development process, from initial brainstorming to ongoing maintenance, with a primary emphasis on analysis, prototyping, and development. Our development process is a dynamic blend of agile and rapid prototyping methodologies, designed to foster a culture of "flexibility under responsibility." We prioritize focused development time and believe in the power of collaborative problem-solving, encouraging team members to both seek and offer assistance readily.

Requirements

We welcome candidates with a solid background in data analysis or software development, seeking professionals with proven experience rather than recent graduates. Regardless of your background, a crucial element is your intellectual curiosity, self-motivation, and a demonstrable ability to translate real-world challenges into mathematical models, statistical analyses, algorithms, and ultimately, functional code. A strong interest in machine learning and/or the adtech domain, along with its associated technologies, is highly desirable, as well as knowledge of object-oriented programming languages, particularly Scala.


A strong academic background in a quantitative field (Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related disciplines).
Experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in production.
Proficiency in Python or Scala for machine learning and data processing.
Strong data analysis and feature engineering skills.
Experience with MLOps and building scalable ML pipelines.


Desired Qualifications


Demonstrated experience with Scala or Python for production-ready ML applications.
Software engineering experience, including best practices for code optimization and maintainability.
Knowledge of distributed computing frameworks like Spark for large-scale data processing.
Experience with model optimization techniques and hyperparameter tuning.
Familiarity with auction mechanisms and real-time bidding models.
Experience in market segmentation and audience targeting.
Experience using Airflow for ML pipeline orchestration.
AWS cloud expertise, including SageMaker and other ML-related services.


You approach problems with an analytical mindset and a pragmatic approach to solution development. You are a creative thinker, capable of identifying opportunities and weaknesses in proposed solutions, and constructively contributing your own ideas. You thrive in a dynamic environment, adept at juggling multiple projects and connecting them with underlying data. You recognize that exploring new facets of data often yields greater insights than fine-tuning algorithmic parameters. You are equally comfortable implementing and optimizing solutions, and you are eager to tackle new challenges.

What We Offer

Join our dynamic team, largely comprised of Masters and PhDs in fields like Physics, Math, and Computer Science, and play a key role in shaping the future of our technology. You will collaborate with highly skilled professionals in a stimulating environment that fosters both learning and individual initiative. While we are passionate about exploring cutting-edge technologies and algorithms, we maintain a practical approach to implementing solutions.

We believe in empowering our employees with autonomy and flexibility. We offer flexible work arrangements, including adjustable office hours and the possibility of occasional remote work, provided commitments are consistently fulfilled. You will have the freedom to select your preferred operating system (Linux, Mac, Windows) and development tools, with the expectation of independent maintenance and troubleshooting. We encourage the introduction of new technologies, contingent upon demonstrating their value and gaining team buy-in.

Our international presence provides ample opportunities for cross-departmental collaboration and potential career advancement in locations like Berlin, San Francisco or New York. This full-time position (37 hours per week) is based at our Copenhagen office, located at Bernstorffsgade 21. A competitive benefits package is provided, including lunch, telephone/internet, and health insurance. The ideal candidate will be available to start as soon as possible.

Interested candidates are encouraged to apply via LinkedIn, submitting a cover letter along with their application. Interviews will be scheduled on a continuous basis.

This is a hybrid role based out of Copenhagen.

PEOPLE & CULTURE AT ZETA

Zeta considers applicants for employment without regard to, and does not discriminate on the basis of an individual’s sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, status as a veteran, or national or ethnic origin; nor does Zeta discriminate on the basis of sexual orientation, gender identity or expression.

We’re committed to building a workplace culture of trust and belonging, so everyone feels invited to bring their whole selves to work. We provide a forum for employees to celebrate, support and advocate for one another. Learn more about our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion here: https://zetaglobal.com/blog/a-look-into-zetas-ergs/

ZETA IN THE NEWS!

https://zetaglobal.com/press/?cat=press-releases

Title: Soon-to-be or newly graduated Software Developer
Description:
Are you passionate about developing and delivering valuable software solutions that help improve the daily lives of our customers in the defence sector? Then seize this opportunity to get your career off to an exciting start at Systematic! The knowledge and drive that you will undoubtedly bring to the job will be greatly valued from day one.

The job we offer
Joining Systematic as a newly graduated Developer, you will work alongside dedicated colleagues who share your passion for creating the best solutions for our customers. We encourage knowledge sharing and are constantly trying to develop smarter processes. In a working environment characterised by a structured work environment, high levels of responsibility, influence, and freedom, you can grow and determine your path, either as a Software Specialist, Software Architect or Project Manager.

This job is for you if you want to work with various technological solutions and methods. It is an advantage for your work if you are familiar with some of the following technologies, which we use:


Java EE, .NET (C#), Scala – here, experience with Java would be a plus
HTML, CSS, JavaScript (Angular/AngularJS)
REST, HTTP/S
SQL (MSSQL, MySQL, PostgreSQL)
Spring Boot
Docker
Kubernetes



However, let us talk to see whether we can find the perfect match for you! As long as you bring the foundation and motivation, we can support you in learning much of the rest. 

Developing excellent software to save lives
At Systematic, we believe that software, when built and used properly, can help create a better society for everyone. As a Software Developer within our Defence business area, you will have the opportunity to develop software solutions that simplify complex processes and increase efficiency for our customers.

Our teams value collaboration and a commitment to excellence, which means you will have the chance to work closely with and learn from experienced professionals who are dedicated to delivering high-quality software solutions. From your first day with us, you will receive comprehensive training and ongoing support to ensure your success – and this includes having a mentor. We know that you still have to learn, but what better way to learn than by doing it?

Right now, we are looking for new colleagues who are passionate about software development and making a difference in the world. So, if you share this passion with us and are excited about the prospect of working with meaningful projects impacting society, while growing your professional software competencies, we sincerely hope that you apply.

Your Qualifications
We are looking for new colleagues with a master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or something similar. Especially if you are about to graduate and are keen to apply your technological skills. The specific tech stack that you will work with depends on your interests and which team you will join.

Nevertheless, it is advantageous if:


You are cooperative and strive to make a positive contribution to team dynamics.
You are ambitious and always working to improve yourself as a motivated team player.
You work systematically while paying close attention to detail, and you take pride in understanding complex solutions and customer challenges.
You are fluent in English, as it is our corporate language used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.



Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

What To Expect From Systematic
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your career with us
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis and expect to conduct interviews ongoingly too, expectedly in May and June as we wish to welcome our new colleagues for a thorough onboarding programme after the Summer, starting September 1st.

So click Apply Now and send us your CV today.

If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Julie Lysbjerg Christensen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant, for more information about the position.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant


Show more

We know that you still have to learn, but what better way to learn than by doing it?

Right now, we are looking for new colleagues who are passionate about software development and making a difference in the world. So, if you share this passion with us and are excited about the prospect of working with meaningful projects impacting society, while growing your professional software competencies, we sincerely hope that you apply.

Your Qualifications
We are looking for new colleagues with a master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or something similar. Especially if you are about to graduate and are keen to apply your technological skills. The specific tech stack that you will work with depends on your interests and which team you will join.

Nevertheless, it is advantageous if:

  • You are cooperative and strive to make a positive contribution to team dynamics.
  • You are ambitious and always working to improve yourself as a motivated team player.
  • You work systematically while paying close attention to detail, and you take pride in understanding complex solutions and customer challenges.
  • You are fluent in English, as it is our corporate language used daily in conversations with colleagues worldwide.


Please note that you must be able to present a clean criminal record and have lived in a NATO/EU country for the past seven years as we work with security-classified projects. Read more here.

What To Expect From Systematic
Systematic is truly international, proudly Danish and uniquely people-centric. Together, we write intelligent and innovative code to drive progress and improve lives. We develop IT solutions that make a real difference where it matters most. This is why we never stop developing. Here, there is room to be professional and personal. It is not just a place to work but a place to belong.

You can look forward to joining our Employees Club, which offers almost 100 events of both social and professional character a year – plenty to choose from. Our colleagues also highlight our canteen, which serves various delicious and healthy dishes daily. In addition, we offer several employee benefits such as paid Home Internet, health insurance and a company pension scheme. Finally, we are always up for a friendly game of padel at our new padel court in Aarhus!

Start your career with us
We will be assessing applications on an ongoing basis and expect to conduct interviews ongoingly too, expectedly in May and June as we wish to welcome our new colleagues for a thorough onboarding programme after the Summer, starting September 1st.

So click Apply Now and send us your CV today.

If you have any questions, you are always welcome to contact us on tel. +45 8943 2000 and ask for Julie Lysbjerg Christensen, Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant, for more information about the position.

Get in touch

Julie Lysbjerg Christensen

Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant

Title: Applied AI Customer Engineer, Google Cloud (English, Nordics)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Stockholm, Sweden; Helsinki, Finland; Copenhagen, Denmark; London, UK.Minimum qualifications:


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, AI, Applied Math, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in a customer-facing role in the enterprise technology space.
Experience building conversational applications and contact center applications.
Experience building integrations using one or more of the following languages: Python, Node.js, Go, or Java.
Ability to communicate in English and one of the local nordics languages fluently to manage client relationships in the region.


Preferred qualifications:


Experience working with modern cloud architectures and technologies.
Experience with contact center technologies and platforms (e.g., Avaya, Genesys, Cisco, Mitel, Twilio, Liveperson, etc.) or Cloud Contact Center solutions.
Experience with Google Cloud's artificial intelligence solutions.
Experience in business strategy, business development and translating customer needs into solutions.
Ability to collaborate effectively across organizational boundaries and ambiguous, matrixed environments while building relationships to achieve business goals.


About The Job

As an EMEA Applied AI Customer Engineer, you will be responsible for growing the adoption of Google’s Applied AI Customer Engagement Suite in EMEA by virtue of your experience in building conversational applications. You will form part of a highly specialized technical team that engages directly with customers and partners with the focus on generating value for customers with AI-driven customer engagement, and thereby accelerating the usage and adoption of Applied AI, and especially Conversational AI solutions on Google Cloud Platform.

In this role, you will work with cross-functional peers to support selected enterprise customers in their AI Customer Engagement journey, working closely with peers in Sales, Partner team, Product, and Engineering. You will support growing the ecosystem of partners by running technical workshops and training. You will run customer demonstrations and small proofs of concept and provide feedback to Global Product Leads and Product Management to ensure customer success, and influence the evolution of the product to meet customer needs.

Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.

Responsibilities


Secure technical wins with top EMEA customers, by showcasing the Google Cloud Customer Engagement Suite, Including Conversational Agents, Agent Assist, Conversational Insights and Google Contact Center AI Platform (CCaaS), etc.
Build custom demos and presentations aligned with customers’ unique needs, running technical workshops, answering RFPs (Request for Proposal).
Understand customers' needs to create and lead technical workshops, including creating and presenting content, building demos to illustrate customer value, and supporting customers post-sales to ensure continued success.
Work with peers in the Google partner team, support efforts to build and nurture a community of AI partners and practitioners for Applied AI across EMEA.
Ensure field readiness on Customer Engagement Suite, including contributing to internal training as a lead expert, and contributing to the internal and external Applied AI community.



Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .
Show more

Title: 应用数学家 - 台湾
Description:
Outlier幫助世界上最具創新性的公司通過提供人類反饋來改進他們的AI模型。您是一位經驗豐富的數學專家，願意將您的專業知識用於訓練AI模型嗎？

關於這個機會：

Outlier正在尋找有才華的數學專家來幫助訓練生成型人工智能模型。這個自由職業的機會是遠程工作的，工作時間靈活，因此您可以在最適合您的時間工作。您可以通過以下方式貢獻您的專業知識：


評估AI模型生成的專業領域文本的真實性和相關性
設計並回答與數學相關的問題
評估並對AI模型生成的專業領域回應進行排序


期望的專業知識範例：


擁有數學或相關學科的學士學位或更高學位
擁有作為數學專業人士的工作經驗
能够用流利的英语和台语清晰地书写与数学相关的概念


薪資：


目前，數學專家在核心項目工作的薪資範圍為每小時19.5至50美元。
薪資根據專業知識、技能評估、地點、項目需求及其他因素有所不同。例如，對於擁有博士學位的人，可能會提供更高的薪資。對於非核心工作，例如項目初期的入職培訓或項目加班階段，可能會適用較低的薪資。某些項目會提供獎勳支付。請查看每個項目的支付條款。

Title: Senior Scientist for Down Stream Process Development
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Senior Scientist for Down Stream Process Development

Are you driven by the challenge of turning lab-scale processes into robust, scalable production systems?
Does developing and optimizing downstream recovery of innovative food ingredients excite you?
Are you looking to make a tangible impact in an innovative startup environment?




Join Chromologics as our Senior Scientist for Downstream Process Development and help shape the future of food colorants through precision fermentation.




At Chromologics, we’re on a mission to revolutionize the food industry by producing sustainable, fermentation-based natural colorants. With solid support from international investors and a team of 17 professionals across fermentation, biotechnology, food science, and business, we are advancing from pilot operations to commercial readiness.




Your Role: Advancing Downstream Processes




As Senior Scientist for Downstream Process Development, you’ll lead the development and scale-up of pigment recovery from our precision fermentation processes. Your responsibilities span from hands-on development in our pilot facility to process transfer and technical collaboration with external manufacturing partners.




In this role, you will:

Design, optimize, and scale downstream unit operations, including solid/liquid separation, membrane filtration (ultra/nano)
Evaluate, select, and help install new processing equipment as we expand our in-house DSP line.
Conduct experimental work, troubleshoot processes, and prepare comprehensive documentation to ensure successful tech transfer and production scalability.
Continuously improve performance through data-driven insights, lab trials, and feasibility studies.




What We’re Looking For

You are a curious, self-motivated scientist ready to shape the future of food technology. You thrive in dynamic environments and enjoy solving complex technical challenges.




Your qualifications:




Have a MSc in chemical engineering, biochemical engineering or biotechnology, potentially combined with a PhD.
Have at least 2 years of industrial experience, preferably as a (bio)process engineer, working with fermentation-based manufacturing processes
Strong background in recovery processes e.g., solid/liquid separation, membrane processing, and Solid Phase Extraction.
Have a strong analytical and creative mind, combined with a lot of personal drive
Flair for data analysis e.g., mass balances, drawing conclusions, and presenting outputs to scientific and non-scientific audiences




You’re excited about working in a growing startup where flexibility, initiative, and big-picture thinking are key to success.




Welcome to Chromologics!




Chromologics was founded in 2017 and uses precision fermentation to produce novel colorants. Our technology platform will enable us to be early movers in introducing exclusively lab-grown natural food colorants to the market that are high-performing, cost-competitive, and sustainable alternatives. Unlike other existing natural colors, our colorants are not extracted from high-value labor-intensive raw materials like fruit & vegetables or insects but are produced via fermentation. Chromologics R&D is transforming our work from lab to product commercialization.




Chromologics offers you the ability to gain experience and take on broader responsibilities. We are an international and diverse team located at the Innovation House at Alfa Laval in Søborg – your office will be in Søborg. We thrive on innovation, sustainability, and applied technologies. Our facilities are within cycling and public transportation distance of Copenhagen, with access to the Alfa Laval canteen and fitness facilities. 




Salary and employment terms will match the experience and background of the right candidate.




Any questions please write to COO Karsten Dinesen kdinesen@chromologics.com and use below link to apply.




Application deadline: May 28th, 2025. Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

Show more
