Title: Student - Research & Development
Description:
Terma is facing an exciting future with considerable growth and demanding changes, as we deliver advanced technologies and mission critical solutions for the defense and aerospace industry. Our systems provide security for people on land, at sea and in the air. In space, we are engaged in reaching new frontiers and helping people across the globe tackle current and future challenges.

Terma offers multiple motivating student worker positions in various departments within our Research and Development (R&D) organization.

As a student in R&D, you will experience a variety of tasks and have the opportunity to practice your theoretical skills. We pride ourselves on always having an open work environment where we help each other stay focused, committed, and motivated to deliver value to our colleagues throughout Terma.

Team and role

As a student in R&D, you will be part of an organization with a lot of engaged international employees, where specialized technology, deep knowledge, playful innovation, and continued improvements are driving factors in everything we do.

You will be working closely with highly skilled colleagues, working on exciting internal and external products and projects, and you will be growing together with other passionate students as a part of our internal people pipeline. You might work on the future of software, making the world safer through security, defense and space applications, and through advanced analytics that secures the right decision-making around the world, or you are building the future radars for airports, harbors, and ships.

Qualifications

Your background is not important if you have a passion and interest in working professionally in a high-tech company and look forward to setting your footprint. We are open to candidates from many different programs.

We Are Currently Seeking Student Workers Pursuing a Bachelor’s Or Master’s Degree In Disciplines Such As, But Not Limited To


Software- and Systems Engineering
Data Scientist and Cybersecurity
Management- and Business Development


The Key To Success As a Student Worker Is To Show Commitment, Work With Passion In Groups And Independently, Have An Outgoing And Proactive Personality With Humor And Curiosity, And Show Initiative In Daily Work. Therefore, It Is Essential That


You can communicate in English
You take pride in making things happen, particularly when identifying and proactively dealing with issues
You can solve your tasks within set deadlines and with a strong focus on quality and detail, in close cooperation with your colleagues
You work in a structured manner and can coordinate and manage several things simultaneously without losing track


______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

We encourage all individuals to apply for our job openings, as we are dedicated to fostering a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and welcoming workplace. Our commitment to these DEIB principles means we value and celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences of each team member. We strive to ensure that every employee has equal opportunities to succeed, feels respected and valued, and experiences a strong sense of belonging within our organization.

We encourage you to leave out photo, age, and name.

We do not expect you to write an application, but please send us a motivated resume. To ensure that your application will reach us and is properly processed, we only accept applications via www.terma.com.

Applications will be processed continuously.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Any unanswered questions?

We encourage you to apply as soon as possible, as we invite candidates for interviews on an ongoing basis. If you have any need for further information, please do not hesitate to contact oabh@terma.com

We are really looking forward to receiving your CV.

Bear in mind that candidates must be able to obtain a security clearance by the Danish Defence Intelligence Service. This entails that candidates, as a minimum, have stayed within NATO/EU for the last 7 years only interrupted by short stays abroad.

The Denmark based high-tech Terma Group develops products and systems for defense and non-defense security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry. TERMA | Allies in innovation.

The high-tech and innovative Terma Group develops products and systems for defense, non-defense and security applications, including command and control systems, radar systems, self-protection systems for aircraft and vessels, space technology, and aerostructures for the aircraft industry.

Headquartered in Aarhus, Denmark, Terma has subsidiaries and operations across Europe, in the Middle East, in Asia Pacific as well as a wholly-owned U.S. subsidiary, Terma Inc., with offices in Washington D.C., Georgia and Texas.

Application deadline:

Ongoing

Title: Scientist for Laboratory Automation Development
Place: Hørsholm Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a Scientist with a flair for IT systems and experience in qualifying analytical instruments — and are you ready to be part of a journey driving laboratory automation and digital transformation?




ALK is a global allergy solution company that offers a wide range of allergy treatments, products, and services to meet the needs of those who suffer from allergies, in search for a skilled Scientist for our Laboratory Automation Development department. In this role, you will join a team of specialists committed to GMP qualification of laboratory equipment and software validation for our analytical laboratories. Also, you will be involved in cross-functional activities in collaboration with IT, QA and the analytical laboratories. The Laboratory Automation Development department is known for its high expertise, professionalism, pro-active and open-minded approach. If you’re ready to make an actual impact and be part of a team that’s shaping the future of laboratory operations at ALK, the Laboratory Automation Development department is the place to be. Join us — we’re in motion, and we’re excited to meet you!




The Position

As a Scientist in the Laboratory Automation Development department, you will be part of the Analytical Development area, which consists of 40 dedicated colleagues organized into four departments and a core team. You will report directly to the Associate Director of Laboratory Automation Development.




The Laboratory Automation Development team currently includes six experienced specialists and is responsible for the scouting, implementation, qualification, and lifecycle management of analytical equipment and software systems running at ALK’s analytical laboratories. In addition, the team acts as system and data owners for key analytical platforms and their associated data and are responsible for driving the laboratory automation agenda within the CMC area. Organisationally, Analytical Development is part of Global CMC Development within the Research and Development area.




Responsibilities:

Perform qualification of new analytical instruments and validation of computerized systems for both development and GMP laboratories.
Prepare qualification and validation documentation including risk assessments, protocols, and reports.
Ensure the validated and qualified state of laboratory systems is maintained throughout their lifecycle.
Work in compliance with applicable regulations and guidelines, including 21 CFR Part 11/211, EU GMP Guide, Annex 11 and 15, and GAMP5 principles.
Support audits and inspections by providing documentation and subject matter expertise.
Collaborate cross-functionally with IT, QA, and laboratory stakeholders to ensure efficient implementation and operation of qualified systems.
Contribute to the identification, evaluation, and implementation of new systems and technologies that support automation and digitalization of laboratory operations.




Your profile

We are looking for a Scientist who:

Holds a Master's degree or a PhD in engineering, natural sciences, or a related field.
Has solid experience in qualification and validation of analytical instruments and laboratory software, preferably in both development and GMP environments.
Has a good understanding of laboratory digitalization and is motivated to support the introduction of new technologies that improve laboratory efficiency.
Is driven by the opportunity to enhance and streamline processes and systems.
Has experience within programming.
Is adaptable, solution-oriented, and thrives in a dynamic environment.
Has strong communication and collaboration skills, contributing to a culture of quality, innovation, and continuous improvement.




Become a part of ALK

We provide an attractive working environment for individuals looking for both personal and professional development. ALK is a global pharmaceutical company specialised in allergy immunotherapy. We are driven by a high level of professionalism, integrity, an openminded approach and contributing to an inspiring and fun working environment together with our colleagues. You will be part of an engaged and informal team who values development of skills and knowledge. We will provide the necessary training for you to become a specialist in instrument validation and qualification. The result of your efforts will be significant throughout the organisation, and you will be able to actively influence and challenge the status quo.




Our offices in Denmark offer a green view of the DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We believe that physical presence enforces strong teamwork and collaboration and creates success, so it is important that you enjoy coming to work at our site with a degree of flexibility to also work from home. Do you want to learn more about our company, we encourage you to visit us at www.alk.net.




Apply

Apply by attaching your CV and a short letter of motivation, no later than 1 June 2025.




We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. Hence, we prefer that you do not add images in your application documents. We evaluate applications and call for interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait to apply! We reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.




For further information regarding the position please contact Associate Director, Rune S. Gustafsson at +45 50899596.




We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Show more
HTML:
Are you a Scientist with a flair for IT systems and experience in qualifying analytical instruments — and are you ready to be part of a journey driving laboratory automation and digital transformation?


ALK is a global allergy solution company that offers a wide range of allergy treatments, products, and services to meet the needs of those who suffer from allergies, in search for a skilled Scientist for our Laboratory Automation Development department. In this role, you will join a team of specialists committed to GMP qualification of laboratory equipment and software validation for our analytical laboratories. Also, you will be involved in cross-functional activities in collaboration with IT, QA and the analytical laboratories. The Laboratory Automation Development department is known for its high expertise, professionalism, pro-active and open-minded approach. If you’re ready to make an actual impact and be part of a team that’s shaping the future of laboratory operations at ALK, the Laboratory Automation Development department is the place to be. Join us — we’re in motion, and we’re excited to meet you!


The Position

As a Scientist in the Laboratory Automation Development department, you will be part of the Analytical Development area, which consists of 40 dedicated colleagues organized into four departments and a core team. You will report directly to the Associate Director of Laboratory Automation Development.


The Laboratory Automation Development team currently includes six experienced specialists and is responsible for the scouting, implementation, qualification, and lifecycle management of analytical equipment and software systems running at ALK’s analytical laboratories. In addition, the team acts as system and data owners for key analytical platforms and their associated data and are responsible for driving the laboratory automation agenda within the CMC area. Organisationally, Analytical Development is part of Global CMC Development within the Research and Development area.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform qualification of new analytical instruments and validation of computerized systems for both development and GMP laboratories.
  • Prepare qualification and validation documentation including risk assessments, protocols, and reports.
  • Ensure the validated and qualified state of laboratory systems is maintained throughout their lifecycle.
  • Work in compliance with applicable regulations and guidelines, including 21 CFR Part 11/211, EU GMP Guide, Annex 11 and 15, and GAMP5 principles.
  • Support audits and inspections by providing documentation and subject matter expertise.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with IT, QA, and laboratory stakeholders to ensure efficient implementation and operation of qualified systems.
  • Contribute to the identification, evaluation, and implementation of new systems and technologies that support automation and digitalization of laboratory operations.


Your profile

We are looking for a Scientist who:

  • Holds a Master's degree or a PhD in engineering, natural sciences, or a related field.
  • Has solid experience in qualification and validation of analytical instruments and laboratory software, preferably in both development and GMP environments.
  • Has a good understanding of laboratory digitalization and is motivated to support the introduction of new technologies that improve laboratory efficiency.
  • Is driven by the opportunity to enhance and streamline processes and systems.
  • Has experience within programming.
  • Is adaptable, solution-oriented, and thrives in a dynamic environment.
  • Has strong communication and collaboration skills, contributing to a culture of quality, innovation, and continuous improvement.


Become a part of ALK

We provide an attractive working environment for individuals looking for both personal and professional development. ALK is a global pharmaceutical company specialised in allergy immunotherapy. We are driven by a high level of professionalism, integrity, an openminded approach and contributing to an inspiring and fun working environment together with our colleagues. You will be part of an engaged and informal team who values development of skills and knowledge. We will provide the necessary training for you to become a specialist in instrument validation and qualification. The result of your efforts will be significant throughout the organisation, and you will be able to actively influence and challenge the status quo.


Our offices in Denmark offer a green view of the DTU Science Park in Hørsholm. We believe that physical presence enforces strong teamwork and collaboration and creates success, so it is important that you enjoy coming to work at our site with a degree of flexibility to also work from home. Do you want to learn more about our company, we encourage you to visit us at www.alk.net.


Apply

Apply by attaching your CV and a short letter of motivation, no later than 1 June 2025.


We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. Hence, we prefer that you do not add images in your application documents. We evaluate applications and call for interviews on an ongoing basis, so don't wait to apply! We reserve the right to take down the advert when we have found the right candidate.


For further information regarding the position please contact Associate Director, Rune S. Gustafsson at +45 50899596.


We are looking forward to hearing from you!

Title: Engineering Internship
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Shure Scandinavia, we offer internships within different engineering disciplines and we are always on the outlook for talented students, who are passionate about their field of study.

As an intern at Shure, you will be part of the professional team of developers who are passionate about technologies, innovation and product quality. We are eager to share knowledge and to learn from each other - both locally and with our colleagues in the US, India, Scotland and China.

Inclusion, trust and respect for one another is at the core of our robust company culture, and we have a dynamic and open work environment with lots of opportunities for learning and development. Our workplace is inspiring, flexible, and informal with ample possibilities for learning and growth. Shure is an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and cherish inclusion in the workplace.

Responsibilities

Embedded Software

If your passion lies within C, C++ and Python, we can offer you a challenging internship during which you will contribute to the development of new product features and solutions including task estimation, design, implementation and documentation. Our embedded software department spans the globe and you will be part of a knowledgeable team of professional developers.

Application Software

Are you into working with HTML5, CSS, .net, and JavaScript as well as frameworks such as AngularJS and Material Design, then you can as a part of your internship contribute to developing great functionalities to Shure’s growing portfolio of software applications.

Digital Signal Processing

As an intern within Digital Signal Processing, you will be given assignments within design, simulation, development and test of real time audio signal processing algorithms for fixed-and-floating-point DSPs. Also, you will be making simulations in Matlab and Simulink as well as using C, C++ and DSP assembly languages.

FPGA

An internship within FPGA and Integrated Circuits Design will include design and coordination of FPGA circuits with use of VHDL for implementation of core signal processing and control elements as well as interfaces to other hardware. In addition hereto, you will be doing circuits test and analysis.

DevOps

If you like automation, you can help Shure to deliver faster by automating repetitive tasks. In DevOps, we help teams deliver firmware, software and data by streamlining our build set-up. We use Jenkins, Git (Bitbucket), Python 3.4+, Linux and Docker as well as PostgreSQL and Windows, and we visualize data using Grafana that enables our colleagues to make data driven decisions.

System Verification

Do you believe artificial intelligence and machine learning are the way forward for automation? Then we can offer you a challenging internship where you will be part of a team that strives to use automation for collecting data points to evaluate the health of our products and ecosystems on a global level.

Qualifications

Your profile and application:

As a person, you are focused and have an eye for detail. You see opportunities in the challenges that occur during your work day you and you enjoy collaborating with team members from different parts of the world. Shure is a global company and we have many talented developers who are always ready to review and discuss new ideas, methods and solutions. Ignite the pure power of engineering: Join Shure and have a great internship.

At Shure, in addition to practical experience, you receive salary during your internship.

When you apply, please tell us why you are interested in an Internship at Shure and remember to include an overview of the courses - including grades - you have completed. Pleae also include information on when you expect to start your internship according to your studies.

Title: Data Enablement Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About the job




Role Overview

As a Data Enablement Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you'll play a crucial role in building and evolving our streaming-first, self-service data platform, enabling software developers, data scientists, analysts, and product teams to efficiently address complex operational and analytical challenges. Your contributions will directly influence data-driven decision-making and product innovation across the organization.

Specifically you will support internal teams’ adoption of the platform, creating reusable patterns, documentation, and providing consultative support for complex use-cases. You should expect that the role will involve a lot of hands-on data engineering (co-engineering/peer programming) initially.




About Us

At Ønskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally.




Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. Our benefits include daily lunches, comprehensive health insurance, lively social events, and much more. This position is not remote. Relocation packages are not offerred.




Key Responsibilities

Initially, handle building the first set of stream/batch processing pipelines and reusable patterns to bootstrap self-service adoption.
Develop documentation, templates, blueprints, examples, and reference implementations for analysts and developers.
Conduct onboarding, training sessions, workshops, and ongoing enablement.
Support software developers and analysts when they face complex scenarios or edge cases.
Gradually shift from initial ownership to advisory/support as internal users gain maturity and autonomy.




Technical Experience

Stream Processing & Data Engineering:
Apache Flink, Apache Spark, Apache Beam
Experience in building and optimizing streaming/batch pipelines (transformations, aggregations, joins, enrichments).
Data Modeling & Schema Management:
Schema Registry, Avro, Protobuf, JSON Schema, schema evolution practices.
Data modelling (star-schema, OBT, semantic)
Analytical & Operational Use-Cases:
Understanding of analytical data use-cases, real-time dashboards, or operational applications.
Exposure to SQL and analytical tools (Databricks SQL, Snowflake, BigQuery, Looker, Tableau).
Exposure to DBT
Documentation & Communication:
Experience producing technical documentation, user guides, tutorials.
Strong ability to explain technical concepts clearly and concisely to varied audiences (analysts, engineers, managers).




Nice-to-Have

Proactive, customer-centric mindset—actively identifying user needs and gaps.
Excellent interpersonal skills to collaborate closely with internal users.
Experience delivering training sessions, workshops, or technical presentations.
Comfortable providing guidance and mentorship in complex situations.




Preferred Qualifications

3+ years of experience in Data Engineering, Analytics Engineering, or Developer Advocacy roles.
Past experience in an enablement, consulting, or advisory position strongly preferred.
Demonstrated track record of improving adoption and maturity of self-service data platforms.

Title: Software Engineer, CloudKitchens - Aarhus Denmark
Description:
Who We Are

At CloudKitchens, we're building Infrastructure for Better Food. We help restaurateurs around the world succeed in online food delivery. Our goal is to make food more affordable, higher quality and convenient for everyone. We're changing the game for restaurateurs, whether they’re entrepreneurs opening their first restaurant all the way through to your favorite global quick-service restaurant chains.

What You’ll Do


Design and build fault-tolerant architectural systems that scale proportionally with business growth and can stand the test of time.
Operate storage and network across our multi-regional fleet of Kubernetes clusters and manage lifecycle with automation.
Write, debug, maintain, and test code in a high-velocity agile environment.
Work alongside other engineers and stakeholders to improve overall systems, availability, and SLO.


What We’re Looking For


5+ years of backend software engineering experience, ideally with experience on core infrastructure, or platform engineering teams.
Expertise in distributed systems, and experience designing large-scale distributed systems that are scalable, reliable, and with high performance.
Experience in Golang development.
Nice to have specialized in Kubernetes, Istio, Security, and Network, and public cloud providers like Azure, GCP, and AWS.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent training, fellowship, or work experience.


Why join us


Growing market: You’ll be focused on an $80 billion market that’s projected to reach at least $500 billion by 2030 in the US alone.
Changing the restaurant industry: You’ll be part of a team that helps restaurants succeed in online food delivery.
Collaborative environment: You will receive support and guidance from experienced colleagues and managers, helping you to learn, grow and achieve your goals, and you’ll work closely with other teams to ensure our customer’s success.


What Else You Need To Know

We are hiring across Infrastructure Network and Storage teams, Multiple seats are available for candidates who are eager to learn and grow their technical in-depth.

This role is based in our Aarhus office location. We believe that people do their best work when they are together. As a company, we’re in the marketplace of ideas and innovation. When you’re constantly innovating, changing how an industry works, inventing new products and processes - and we are doing all these things - we believe we’re better as a team in-person. That’s why all of our teams (except for our field-based roles) are now working from one of our office locations 5 days a week. Looking forward to sharing more about a Career of Substance at City Storage Systems.

Ready to join us as we serve those who serve others?

For more information about our privacy policy, please view this link here: css-careers.com/privacy

Title: Bliv Data Scientist hos KOMBIT og vær med til at drive arbejdet med AI i kommunerne!
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Kan du se dig selv have medansvar for at levere innovative og værdiskabende AI-løsninger til kommunerne? Så har vi netop den rette stilling til dig.




Et stærkt it-fællesskab

I KOMBIT har de danske kommuner et fælles omdrejningspunkt med stærke og specialiserede kompetencer på digitaliseringsområdet. Vi er et kommunalt ejet it-fællesskab, der er ansvarlig for at indkøbe, forvalte, drifte og videreudvikle tidssvarende og stabile it-løsninger og -infrastruktur til gavn for borgere og virksomheder. Sammen med kommunerne og it-leverandørerne arbejder vi for, at borgere og virksomheder i Danmark får en bedre service og billigere og mere sammenhængende it-løsninger. KOMBITs ambition er at sikre fortsat kommunal digital bevægelse - i dag og i fremtiden.




Vi har et stærkt fokus på at levere ansvarlige og sikre AI-løsninger, der kan komme i produktion og skabe reel værdi for kommunerne.




Dine primære ansvarsområder

Du bliver tilknyttet specialet Design & Arkitektur. Vi arbejder sammen med bl.a. KL, kommunerne, og vores leverandører for at udbrede AI i den kommunale sektor. Du bliver en del af et tværfagligt team som arbejder fokuseret med AI og du bliver involveret i konkrete udviklingsprojekter.

Vi søger en passioneret og dygtig Data Scientist, der vil være med til at udvikle og implementere AI-løsninger. Du vil få mulighed for at integrere disse løsninger med de fælleskommunale fagsystemer og på sigt bidrage til arbejdet med fælles komponenter og platforme til at udbrede AI effektivt. Dette indebærer spændende muligheder for at arbejde med banebrydende teknologi og skabe reel værdi for kommunerne.




Som Data Scientist hos KOMBIT vil du bl.a. komme til at arbejde med vores AI Assistent, som er udviklet for at hjælpe kommunale sagsbehandlere med at anvende fagsystemer og søge information i lovgivningen. Assistenten anvendes også internt i KOMBIT. Derudover vil du blive involveret i at udvikle eller indkøbe nye AI-løsninger og få mulighed for at bidrage til kortlægning og screening af nye AI use cases. Derudover vil du komme til at arbejde med dataanalyser, evaluering og overvågning af AI og meget mere.




På længere sigt vil du få mulighed for at få ansvar for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af et eller flere AI-produkter, herunder at sikre, at de lever op til brugernes behov og vores standarder og metoder mm. Derudover får du mulighed for at bidrage til at opbygge og forbedre KOMBITs processer og standarder for AI-udvikling, drift osv.




Vi er på udkig efter flere nye kollegaer til teamet, så uanset om du er erfaren eller relativ nyuddannet, så tøv ikke med at søge stillingen.




Fokus på dig og dit (arbejds)liv

Vi tilbyder dig et job, hvor omdrejningspunktet er samarbejde på tværs, og hvor du vil arbejde med nogle af Danmarks største it-løsninger. Samtidig bliver du en del af en ambitiøs virksomhed, der står i udviklingens tegn, både hvad angår de mange eksisterende løsninger samt forventningen om en fremtid med endnu bredere portefølje inden for digitalisering og it-dreven innovation i kommunerne.




I KOMBIT er det vigtigt, at alle medarbejdere finder en god balance mellem arbejde og privatliv. Vi skaber motiverende rammer, der giver medarbejderne frihed til at planlægge og løse deres opgaver ud fra individuelle behov. Af samme grund vil du hurtigt opleve, at der er højt til loftet og rig mulighed for at sætte dit præg i en hver fyldt med spændende opgaver. Vi har som organisation fokus på dig og dit (arbejds)liv i balance – vi kalder det LiFE!




Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så tag første skridt mod en spændende karriere i frontlinjen for digital udvikling, og giv Chef for Design & Arkitektur, Lars Vraa et kald på 29388873, så vi han fortælle mere om stillingen samt høre din motivation for at søge stillingen.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig.

Show more

Derudover vil du blive involveret i at udvikle eller indkøbe nye AI-løsninger og få mulighed for at bidrage til kortlægning og screening af nye AI use cases. Derudover vil du komme til at arbejde med dataanalyser, evaluering og overvågning af AI og meget mere.


På længere sigt vil du få mulighed for at få ansvar for udvikling og vedligeholdelse af et eller flere AI-produkter, herunder at sikre, at de lever op til brugernes behov og vores standarder og metoder mm. Derudover får du mulighed for at bidrage til at opbygge og forbedre KOMBITs processer og standarder for AI-udvikling, drift osv.


Vi er på udkig efter flere nye kollegaer til teamet, så uanset om du er erfaren eller relativ nyuddannet, så tøv ikke med at søge stillingen.


Fokus på dig og dit (arbejds)liv

Vi tilbyder dig et job, hvor omdrejningspunktet er samarbejde på tværs, og hvor du vil arbejde med nogle af Danmarks største it-løsninger. Samtidig bliver du en del af en ambitiøs virksomhed, der står i udviklingens tegn, både hvad angår de mange eksisterende løsninger samt forventningen om en fremtid med endnu bredere portefølje inden for digitalisering og it-dreven innovation i kommunerne.


I KOMBIT er det vigtigt, at alle medarbejdere finder en god balance mellem arbejde og privatliv. Vi skaber motiverende rammer, der giver medarbejderne frihed til at planlægge og løse deres opgaver ud fra individuelle behov. Af samme grund vil du hurtigt opleve, at der er højt til loftet og rig mulighed for at sætte dit præg i en hver fyldt med spændende opgaver. Vi har som organisation fokus på dig og dit (arbejds)liv i balance – vi kalder det LiFE!


Lyder det som noget for dig?

Så tag første skridt mod en spændende karriere i frontlinjen for digital udvikling, og giv Chef for Design & Arkitektur, Lars Vraa et kald på 29388873, så vi han fortælle mere om stillingen samt høre din motivation for at søge stillingen.


Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig.

Title: Backend Engineer (Remote)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
About Agreena

Agreena is an exciting, dynamic, and purpose-oriented organisation united in a mission to mobilise farmers and corporations to unlock the value of nature and help restore the planet. While we’re rooted in agriculture, finance, and technology, our team of experts range from soil carbon scientists and software developers to market strategists and regulatory affairs experts. Over 160 employees across more than 30 nationalities are gathered under the common Agreena flag – either working from our headquarters in Copenhagen, offices in London, or remotely across Europe.

As a rapidly scaling climate agtech, Agreena provides solutions that drive both environmental and financial sustainability in farming. We have helped farmers across 20 countries in their journey from conventional agriculture to regenerative farming practices to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and remove CO2 from the atmosphere, storing it in soil. Our company offers a supportive and positive work environment with opportunities for learning, leading and growth no matter where you are in your professional journey. We believe in giving our employees a lot of responsibility, and we encourage new thinking, innovation and fun.

How Will You Make An Impact

  • Contributing to the design, implementation, and integration of product features;
  • Solving technical problems with moderate scope and complexity;
  • Supporting the improvement of our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices in a high-scale web environment.

Who We’re Looking For

  • Solid experience with Node.js & Typescript;
  • Ability to write well-designed, testable, and efficient code;
  • Experience with writing APIs (REST) and API documentation (Swagger);
  • Experience with Node.js frameworks (we use Nest.js, but other frameworks are also accepted);
  • Exposure to integrating with 3rd party services (Stripe, DocuSign, etc.);
  • Experience of data modeling, SQL, and database (relational and non-relational) concepts;
  • Knowledge of TDD and Jest;
  • Great communication skills;
  • Proactive attitude towards learning and improving technical skills.

Bonus Points If You Have

  • Some experience on performance optimization - application monitoring, profiling, caching strategies and improvements implementation;
  • Basic knowledge of deployments and other dev-ops configurations with technologies like Docker and/or AWS services such as S3, EC2, etc.

What's In It For You

  • A unique opportunity to join and help shape a fast-growing tech scale up with the determination and ambitious mission to reverse climate change;
  • A truly global environment where you can collaborate and socialise with diverse and passionate colleagues;
  • Competitive compensation package and holidays;
  • Remote Work Policy;
  • Team events throughout the year;
  • An exciting purpose-led culture and mission;
  • Open communication and supportive feedback culture.

🌱 Not quite what you're looking for?

Stay connected with us by following our Agreena LinkedIn page. It's the best way to stay updated on our latest content, articles, and exciting new opportunities.

Plus, if you want to be the first to know about job openings in the departments you're interested in, you can subscribe to our job alerts talent pool.

🌍 Be your best self every day at Agreena

At Agreena, we are devoted to building an environment that promotes equality, inclusion, and diversity. As we embark on our journey of expansion and growth, we recognise the value of celebrating and embracing everyone's uniqueness. This diversity is crucial to our success and innovation. We aspire to build a product that is loved by our customers and we want the same to be reflected in our teams.

With this in mind, we're dedicated to ensuring that Agreena remains a welcoming and diverse environment for all.

Title: Data Platform Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Role Overview

As a Data Platform Engineer in the Data Engineering team, you'll play a crucial role in building and evolving our streaming-first, self-service data platform, enabling software developers, data scientists, analysts, and product teams to efficiently address complex operational and analytical challenges. Your contributions will directly influence data-driven decision-making and product innovation across the organization.




You will focus on engineering scalable, automated infrastructure solutions—leveraging technologies such as Pub/Sub, Flink, BigQuery, Kubernetes, Terraform, and Airflow—while ensuring reliability, security, and operational excellence. Expect the role to involve substantial infrastructure automation, performance optimization, and close collaboration with Data Enablement Engineers to ensure seamless adoption and optimal utilization of the platform.




About Us

At Ønskeskyen / GoWish, we are witnessing substantial growth with our innovative digital wish list application, which is gaining popularity both in Denmark and globally.




Location

Our office is located in the vibrant district of Nordhavn, Copenhagen, Denmark, where we foster an energetic work atmosphere. Our benefits include daily lunches, comprehensive health insurance, lively social events, and much more. This position is not remote. Relocation packages are not offerred.




Key Responsibilities

Build, manage, and evolve the self-service infrastructure (Pubsub, Flink, Bigquery, Dataflow, Dataproc, Airflow, etc).
Set up automated deployment, CI/CD, monitoring, observability, security, scalability.
Maintain and enforce schema governance, metadata management, and observability frameworks.
Provide infrastructure-level support for complex operational scenarios (e.g., scaling, latency optimization, infrastructure stability).

Technical qualifications

Mulitple programming languages
We primarily use Scala, Java, SQL and Python
Distributed processing frameworks
Spark, Flink, Beam, or similar
Infrastructure & Cloud
GCP/AWS/Azure (we use GCP)
Terraform, Kubernetes, Docker, Helm
Storage & Lakehouse
Delta lake, Apache Iceberg, Apache Paimon
Observability & Monitoring
Prometheus, Google Cloud montioring, Grafana
DevOps & Automation
Github Actions, ArgoCD

Solid grounding in data engineering principles, and data visualisation.Strong problem-solving abilities and collaboration skills.Skilled in processing large datasets and deriving actionable insights.Prompt engineering for LLM applications.




Nice-to-Have

Strong understanding of distributed systems, scalability, and high availability.
Schema governance and serialization formats (Avro, Protobuf, JSON Schema).
Security fundamentals: IAM, RBAC, Encryption, network security principles.
Infrastructure-as-Code practices.




Preferred Qualifications

3–5+ years experience in Data/Platform Engineering or DevOps roles.
Experience implementing or managing streaming data platforms at scale.
Excellent debugging, troubleshooting, and performance-tuning skills.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Software Engineer (Node.js) - High-Performance e-commerce Product Catalog & Stream Processing




About Us

Ønskeskyen is an innovative platform serving millions of users across the United States and Europe. We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our Product Data team which manages around 2 billion e-commerce products, providing accurate and daily updates on most products. We work with high-performance technologies and tackle challenges involving real-time data processing, industry-scale web scraping, and high throughput product catalog imports.




What You'll Be Doing

Developing scalable, high-performance backend services using Node.js, NestJS, and TypeScript.
Building and optimizing advanced web scraping systems capable of handling billions of products daily.
Implementing real-time data pipelines and stream processing solutions using Kafka.
Leveraging in-memory caching with Redis to ensure extremely fast data retrieval and updates.
Working closely with our distributed NoSQL databases for handling large-scale data effectively.
Collaborating in a cross-functional agile team, participating actively in architectural discussions, code reviews, and knowledge-sharing sessions.




Your Technical Skills

Strong expertise in Node.js and dependency injection frameworks such as NestJS.
Solid understanding and hands-on experience with Kafka or other stream processing tools.
Practical experience working with Redis or other in-memory databases for caching.
Proficient in managing and optimizing NoSQL or SQL databases.
Familiarity with cloud-native technologies, containerization (Docker/Kubernetes), and microservices architecture.
Experience managing distributed systems and microservices at scale.




Who We're Looking For

A highly motivated individual who enjoys solving challenging technical problems and taking ownership of projects.
Someone excited about working with cutting-edge technologies on impactful, real-world problems.
Excellent communication skills, capable of clearly articulating complex technical topics.
A team player eager to share knowledge and learn from colleagues.
Fluent in English (both written and spoken).
Ability to work in our Copenhagen office 3 times per week.




Bonus Points For

Experience designing and implementing efficient web scraping systems.
Experience with MongoDB or other NoSQL databases in production use-cases.
Experience with multi-cluster/multi-regional deployments and databases.
Experience with graph databases or advanced data storage solutions.
Proven knowledge of high-performance applications dealing with high I/O scenarios.
Experience using BigQuery or similar data warehouse for analytics and Grafana for monitoring and visualization.




Why Join Us

Work on exciting challenges involving billions of daily transactions, directly impacting millions of users.
Engage with cutting-edge technologies like Kafka, Redis, Kubernetes, MongoDB, and BigQuery in a dynamic and stimulating environment.
A friendly, social, and energetic workplace located in Østerbro, Copenhagen.
Competitive salary, pension scheme, private health insurance, daily catered lunch, Friday bars, social activities, company events, and more!




Interested?

Connect with Vince Biro (vb@onskeskyen) here on LinkedIn to learn more or ask any questions you may have. We look forward to welcoming you to our team!

Title: Software Developer
Description:
Stillingsbeskrivelse

Vil du være med til at udvikle nogle af branchens vigtigste og mest komplekse IT-løsninger? Som Software Developer i Netcompany vil du være med til at gøre en mærkbar forskel for både vores offentlige og private kunder.

Arbejdsopgaver og teknologi

Som Software Developer vil du blive en del af vores Netcompany Application Services, der består af en fast teamstruktur, der driver porteføljer af spændende kunder og projekter. Din hverdag vil være præget af både tekniske og kunderettede opgaver med leverancer, der spænder fra nyudvikling af IT-projekter til løbende udvikling på eksisterende løsninger og serviceydelser.

I Netcompany leverer vi på alle markedsudbredte teknologier herunder .Net, C#, Java, Salesforce, Sharepoint, Dynamics CRM, Business Central ERP, Sitecore, ReactJS, Angular, Docker, Azure, Azure DevOps, Octopus, Oracle, Episerver m.fl. Valget af teknologi bestemmes altid efter, hvad der giver kunden størst værdi. Det er derfor vigtigt, at du synes, det er sjovt at arbejde med nye og varierende områder og teknologier samt finder det motiverende at udbygge din viden kontinuerligt.

Dine arbejdsopgaver kan bl.a. indebære:


Kundedialog og behovsafklaring
Implementering af funktioner i brugergrænsefladen
Programmering af frontend og backend til nye features i kundens løsninger
Opsætning og udvikling af frameworks samt integrationer
Konfiguration og udvikling af extensions til standardplatforme
Automatisering af forretningsprocesser i form af f.eks. batchjobs


Om dig

Vi forestiller os, at du er universitetsuddannet bachelor eller diplomingeniør inden for eksempelvis datalogi, software, IT eller lignende. Derudover forestiller vi os, at du:


Er nyuddannet eller har et par års erfaring - vigtigst er, at du brænder for at tage din karriere inden for IT til næste niveau
Besidder gode IT-tekniske kompetencer inden for objektorienteret programmering
Har et analytisk og problemløsende mindset, der gør dig i stand til at løse komplekse og tekniske opgaver for vores kunder


Fortsæt din udvikling hos os

I Netcompany har vi fokus på din personlige og faglige udvikling.

Når du starter hos os, får du en personlig mentor, som vil vejlede dig igennem din udvikling og i at nå dine mål. Den tætte relation til en erfaren kollega er med til at sikre trivsel for den enkelte medarbejder og giver dig samtidig konkret indblik i de mange forskellige karrieremuligheder, efterhånden som du opbygger din erfaring.

Derudover deltager du i vores uddannelsesprogram, Netcompany Academy, hvor du tilbydes kurser og seminarer, om alt fra teknologier til kundehåndtering. Alle kurser undervises af erfarne Netcompany kolleger, hvilket er med til at sikre, at alt indhold er af høj relevans og bygger ovenpå din faglighed, så du bliver godt klædt på til at varetage forskellige opgaver og hele tiden dygtiggør dig gennem din karriere hos os.

Bliv en del af et inkluderende fællesskab

I Netcompany prioriterer vi fællesskab højt. Vi fremmer aktivt en åben og imødekommende arbejdskultur, der bygger på samarbejde og tillid til hinanden, og hvor der altid er mulighed for sparring.

Det er en del af vores kultur og værdigrundlag, at alle medarbejdere, uanset baggrund, identitet og erfaring mødes med forståelse og respekt samt lige muligheder for udvikling og trivsel.

Du får mulighed for at opnå læring og samarbejde med kolleger på tværs af kulturer og nationaliteter, da vi som international virksomhed har kontorer i mange lande.

Vi tilbyder et fælles miljø, hvor vi engagerer os i hinanden på tværs af afdelinger og projekter. Hertil har vi en lang række af sociale og faglige arrangementer, der giver dig de bedste muligheder for at udvide og opbygge et netværk allerede tidligt i din karriere.

Send os en ansøgning

Upload dit CV og en motiveret ansøgning til vores rekrutteringssystem via linket. Har du ikke fået svar på alle dine spørgsmål, er du velkommen til at skrive til hr.dk@netcompany.com

Alle kvalificerede kandidater opfordres til at søge uanset køn, kønsudtryk, seksualitet, handicap, alder, religion og tro, politisk anskuelse, nationalitet, etnicitet eller sociale baggrund.

Vi er engagerede i at skabe et inkluderende og mangfoldigt miljø. Vores rekrutteringsprocesser er baseret på individuel merit. Hvis du har behov for tilpasninger eller ekstra støtte under ansættelsesprocessen, bedes du sende en e-mail til vores ansvarlige rekrutteringsmedarbejdere på reasonableadjustmentsdk@netcompany.com for hjælp.
Show more

Title: Software Engineer
Description:
The role

As a software engineer at PSQR you will become a part of a highly skilled team. PSQR favour above all the relevancy of technical solutions coming from the team: the hierarchy is flat, and the process of decision making is collaborative – we strive towards choosing good solutions no matter who came up with them.




We are a diverse team of international employees working together at our head office located in the city centre of Copenhagen.




Your profile

We are looking for a candidate with an innovative and solution-oriented approach who can think creatively in complex situations. You are a team player who naturally collaborates across various disciplines and thrives on achieving results together with your colleagues.




Succeeding in a position at PSQR isn’t about a specific set of tools or a fixed process. Instead, it’s your mindset, dedication, and ability to see opportunities rather than limitations that will be key to your success.




You have solid experience with Java development and knowledge with some of the tech stacks mentioned below:

Java
React
Linux
Docker
Cassandra/ScyllaDB
MySQL/MariaDB
RabbitMQ
ElasticSearch
ZooKeeper




Your task and responsibilities:

Develop and maintain backend systems: build, optimise, and maintain backend services for secure supply chain traceability, ensuring scalability and performance
Integrate external systems: Integrate into APIs for external systems, or develop supplemental APIs in the solution for external systems to connect, to secure data-sharing protocols to maintain data integrity and enhance traceability
Extend front-end and mobile components: Extend the web UI or mobile application with additional functionality to serve the needs of the customers
Debug, test, and optimise codebase: identify and resolve software bugs, write tests to ensure code accuracy, and optimise performance
Enhance system security: conduct security audits, manage vulnerabilities, and implement best practices to maintain a secure platform
These are the core tasks that emphasise PSQR’s focus on secure, reliable, and collaborative software development







PSQR is offering

A diverse team of international employees, representing 13 different nationalities, working together at our head office in the city centre of Copenhagen.

A flat organisation, promoting open communication. The employees are empowered to contribute directly, focusing on collaboration and results over titles. This structure creates an agile, dynamic workplace where everyone’s input is valued.

They foster a relaxed, open environment for creativity and open communication, while maintaining high standards in delivering quality work




Application and contact

Randstad manages the recruitment process on behalf of the company. If the position has caught your interest, please apply for the role through this site.




For more detailed information regarding this position, please contact Chief Consultant Kasper Kjærgaard on +45 61 95 92 51. All inquiries will be handled confidentially.




About PSQR

PSQR is a Danish software development company that specialises in providing highly scalable software for storing, processing, and analysing vast amounts of traceability data to industry- as well as government customers. The software is modular and extensible which allows PSQR and our software integration partners to bring it into play for any product vertical all the way from raw materials, through processing, to finished goods, and finally recycling – establishing the complete traceability circle.




About Randstad

Randstad is the world’s largest talent company and a partner of choice to clients. As a Partner for Talent, we are committed to providing equitable opportunities to people from all backgrounds and helping them remain relevant in the rapidly changing world of work.




We have a deep understanding of the labour market and help our clients to create the high-quality, diverse and agile workforces they need to succeed. We support people to realise their true potential throughout their entire working life. This is what we do and what motivates us every day.




Randstad DK is part of the international Randstad Group. Every day, we help more than 600,000 people around the world find jobs. We specialise in finding, attracting, and retaining skilled talent to power businesses at speed and at scale. Randstad DK is a leader in this field, with offices in Copenhagen, Aarhus, Aalborg, and Kolding.

HTML:
The role

As a software engineer at PSQR you will become a part of a highly skilled team. PSQR favour above all the relevancy of technical solutions coming from the team: the hierarchy is flat, and the process of decision making is collaborative – we strive towards choosing good solutions no matter who came up with them.


We are a diverse team of international employees working together at our head office located in the city centre of Copenhagen.


Your profile

We are looking for a candidate with an innovative and solution-oriented approach who can think creatively in complex situations. You are a team player who naturally collaborates across various disciplines and thrives on achieving results together with your colleagues.


Succeeding in a position at PSQR isn’t about a specific set of tools or a fixed process. Instead, it’s your mindset, dedication, and ability to see opportunities rather than limitations that will be key to your success.


You have solid experience with Java development and knowledge with some of the tech stacks mentioned below:

  • Java
  • React
  • Linux
  • Docker
  • Cassandra/ScyllaDB
  • MySQL/MariaDB
  • RabbitMQ
  • ElasticSearch
  • ZooKeeper


Your task and responsibilities:

  • Develop and maintain backend systems: build, optimise, and maintain backend services for secure supply chain traceability, ensuring scalability and performance
  • Integrate external systems: Integrate into APIs for external systems, or develop supplemental APIs in the solution for external systems to connect, to secure data-sharing protocols to maintain data integrity and enhance traceability
  • Extend front-end and mobile components: Extend the web UI or mobile application with additional functionality to serve the needs of the customers
  • Debug, test, and optimise codebase: identify and resolve software bugs, write tests to ensure code accuracy, and optimise performance
  • Enhance system security: conduct security audits, manage vulnerabilities, and implement best practices to maintain a secure platform
  • These are the core tasks that emphasise PSQR’s focus on secure, reliable, and collaborative software development



PSQR is offering

A diverse team of international employees, representing 13 different nationalities, working together at our head office in the city centre of Copenhagen.

A flat organisation, promoting open communication. The employees are empowered to contribute directly, focusing on collaboration and results over titles. This structure creates an agile, dynamic workplace where everyone’s input is valued.

They foster a relaxed, open environment for creativity and open communication, while maintaining high standards in delivering quality work


Application and contact

Randstad manages the recruitment process on behalf of the company. If the position has caught your interest, please apply for the role through this site.


For more detailed information regarding this position, please contact Chief Consultant Kasper Kjærgaard on +45 61 95 92 51. All inquiries will be handled confidentially.

PSQR is a Danish software development company that specialises in providing highly scalable software for storing, processing, and analysing vast amounts of traceability data to industry- as well as government customers. The software is modular and extensible which allows PSQR and our software integration partners to bring it into play for any product vertical all the way from raw materials, through processing, to finished goods, and finally recycling – establishing the complete traceability circle.


About Randstad

Randstad is the world’s largest talent company and a partner of choice to clients. As a Partner for Talent, we are committed to providing equitable opportunities to people from all backgrounds and helping them remain relevant in the rapidly changing world of work.


We have a deep understanding of the labour market and help our clients to create the high-quality, diverse and agile workforces they need to succeed. We support people to realise their true potential throughout their entire working life. This is what we do and what motivates us every day.

Title: Software Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Oase is looking for a human who creates products by writing code.

Also known as: a software engineer.




We’re building a new kind of social technology – one that supports real-world relationships rather than hijacking them. We want tech that strengthens communities instead of pulling them apart.




Oase is a group chat app for people who already know each other in real life – families, friend groups, school classes, local teams. It’s a tool for coordination and communication without all the tricks. No streaks. No endless scroll. No attention traps. Just better tools for real life.




We’re funded and live on the web and in the app stores. Now we’re building the core team.




🛠️ Your role

You’ll join early – like, really early. This means you’ll have real influence on how we build, how we work, and what kind of culture we create together.




You’ll be part of the small (but growing) team, working close togehter with our founder, Anders Lemke-Holstein. Anders has a strong background in product and technology, so you will be able to lean on the foundation he’s built so far. That being said, you’ll also be expected to take ownership of your work and help shape the future of Oase.




The stack you will be working in:

Event sourcing
PostgreSQL
Elixir/Phoenix
React Native + Tailwind




You are not required to know these technologies, but we need you to hit the ground running, so you should be comfortable with similar technologies. We’re looking for someone who can learn quickly, adapt to our stack and execute our roadmap.




👤 You

We’re looking for someone who can help us build a product that’s ethical, humane, and useful.




So we expect that you:




Care about ethics in tech and are aware of the potential impact of your work.
Are not afraid to stand up for your values.
Can execute your ideas.
Are opinionated, but not rigid.
Think people-first.




Ideally you bring a new perspective to the team – whether that’s through your background, your experience, or your interests. We're aiming for a diverse team that can help us build the product and workplace that works for everyone.




🌱 The way we work

It's still too early to have a fully defined and formulated process. But we have clear values and goals for how we want to work together.




Our core values are based on thoughts from regenerative principles, deep work, slow productivity, and resonance.




Regenerative: We want to build a product that is sustainable and ethical. We want to create a workplace that is healthy and supportive.
Deep: We want to create a workplace that allows for deep work because that is where the value is created.
Slow: We want to work at a natural pace. Doing less, but obsessing over quality.
Resonant: We want to create a product that allows for people to resonate with each other, and we want to create a workplace that resonates with us.




🧭 Practical details

We’re based in Copenhagen, but remote-friendly.

Starting date: as soon as possible.

Salary depending on profile – equity is an option.

We’re funded for the next phase and backed by people who care about impact.




📬 Interested or question?




Send a short note to anders@oase.app. Tell us who you are, what you care about – and what you’d love your role to be.
